title: Calm - Sleep, Meditate, Relax
description:
Calm is the #1 app for sleep, meditation and relaxation. Manage stress, balance moods, sleep better and refocus your attention. Guided meditation, Sleep Stories, soundscapes, breathwork and stretching exercises fill our extensive library. Practice self-healing and discover a happier you through Calm.
 
Feel better by reducing anxiety, prioritizing your self-care and choosing a guided meditation session that fits within your busy schedule. Introduce mindfulness and breathing exercises into your daily routine and experience their life-changing benefits. Meditation novice or seasoned expert, Calm is for anyone who is looking to improve their sleep and address everyday stress.
 
Sleep better with Sleep Stories, bedtime stories that lull you into a restful slumber. Relaxing sounds and calming music also help you meditate, focus and sleep soundly. Balance your mood and improve your sleep cycle by picking from 100+ exclusive Sleep Stories, narrated by well-known talent like Cillian Murphy, Ros√©, and Jerome Flynn. Meditate daily to relieve anxiety and learn to put your personal health first.
 
Take a deep breath and find your Calm.
 
CALM FEATURES
 
MEDITATION & MINDFULNESS
* Meditate with seasoned experts, regardless of your experience level
* Be mindful in your daily routine and learn to calm your thoughts
* Mindfulness topics include Deep Sleep, Calming Anxiety, Focus and Concentration, Breaking Habits and so much more
 
SLEEP STORIES, RELAXING MUSIC & SOUNDSCAPES
* Sleep soundly listening to Sleep Stories, bedtime stories for adults and children alike
* Tackle insomnia with calming music, sleep sounds and full soundscapes
* Self-care: Sleep content to help you relax and get into a state of flow
* Relax and experience deep sleep with new music added every week, from top artists
 
ANXIETY RELIEF & RELAXATION
* Stress management and relaxation with daily meditation and breathing exercises
* Self-healing through Dailies - Reduce anxiety with daily 10-minute original programs like the Daily Calm with Tamara Levitt or the Daily Trip with Jeff Warren
* Mental health is Health - Tackle social anxiety and  personal growth through inspiring stories
* Self-care through mindful movement: Relax your body during the day with Daily Move
 
ALSO FEATURING
* Emotion and mental health tracker through Daily Streaks & Mindful Minutes
* Feel better with 7- and 21-day mindfulness programs for beginner & advanced users
* Soundscapes: Nature sounds and scenes to calm your nerves
* Breathing exercises: Find peace and concentration with a mental health coach
 
Calm is free to download and use. There are never any ads and some of the programs and features are free forever. Some content is only available through an optional paid subscription. If you choose to subscribe, payment will be charged to your Google Account at confirmation of purchase.
 
Be sure to check out our Wear OS app with tiles to quick-start breathing exercises and complications that help you track meditations.

What is Calm?
Our mission is to make the world a happier and healthier place. Through our website, blog, and app‚Äîfilled with meditations, sleep stories, music, movement, and more‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining what mental health care looks like in 2021 and beyond. With over 100 million users worldwide, 100,000 new users daily, and our growing partnerships with major companies, we‚Äôre having a positive effect on more and more people each day.
 
Calm is recommended by top psychologists, therapists, mental health experts, and the press:

* ‚ÄúI‚Äôm generally wary of meditation apps because they sometimes weave in too much mystic talk for my taste. But Calm instead contains guidance like ‚ÄòConcentrate on your body‚Äô‚Äù - New York Times

* ‚ÄúIn the frenetic, crazy, digital world we live in, sometimes it's necessary to take a step back and smell the roses‚Äù - Mashable
 
* ‚ÄúEliminating distraction...ended up helping me relax and realize that all the stuff I was stressing about wasn't that big a deal‚Äù - Tech Republic

summary: Tackle everyday stress and anxiety. Self-care and sound sleep through meditation

scraped_reviews.content: I found it difficult to use. I want a brief "calm down" practice, not a 30 minute story, but couldn't figure out how to get that. But most significantly, if I am paying for a subscription, there should be no ads or pop-ups. (If there are ads, the app should be free.) I refuse to both pay a high subscription cost for a phone app AND get inundated with ads. Will be canceling the free trial (hopefully it will really cancel ü§û) and will uninstall.

Good app., does what it professes to do. However, it is very, VERY hard to cancel. I have to believe that the app was designed to intentionally be this difficult to cancel. The level of difficulty bordered on criminal. If the app was as difficult to use as it is to cancel, nobody would ever use it. (By the time I was done successfully canceling it, I was about as uncalm as I've been at any point in the last year.)

the worst. it takes forever to open. some of the sleep stories won't load. for example, Bryan Millar Walker supposedly has a new sleep story and I can find him as a narrator, but when I select him in the search it just chugs (the forever turning circle). no story narrated by him ever comes up. I might have actually kept my subscription if I could listen to new content but it's all the same stuff over and over again. and finding new content is horrible. I can't believe I wasted money on this app.

The UI is overwhelming and there are too many options. for people new to meditation, it feels like drinking out of a firehose. I was gifted a free month of the premium version, and I wont be renewing. I shouldn‚Äôt feel decision fatigue when I'm trying to unwind. If someone hadn't told me what she listens to as a starting point, I would have just let the subscription run out.

you HAVE to pay to use it and it's not clear before downloading or signing in. Yes it gives you a 7 day free trial but other than that you have to pay to use any part of it. If you read all the info it mentions .99+ but a lot apps say that because you CAN buy things but you don't HAVE to pay and are still able to use them . I'm sure it's fine I just wish I'd known ahead of time then I could have made an informed decision. I don't like surprises. Uninstall based solely on non transparency

The Windows version is fine. The Android version is horrid. Distracting. Frustrating. It is constantly trying to show me photos I don't want to see. And every session ends with a summary that is irrelevant and angering to the point where I am considering ending my subscription. Worst part - you don't have a choice.... none of these so-called features can be turned off. And now, I have reached out to Support at least 4 times this year. They don't listen - 9/28/25
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, I'm sorry to hear you didn‚Äôt like the app! Reach out to support@calm.com if you‚Äôd like to provide additional feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: Looking for something simple, keep looking. You must create an account, pick username and password, add friends, click on this and that, go through ad after ad. Then you get a jumbled mess that you have to look through to find a sound. I just want a list of sounds with a timer! Thanks for wasting my time. I'm old and time is precious. NEXT!!

The content is good, but there are constant popups to share the app with others. If I wake and want to start a new story/session I have to click out of an ad before I can do that. I get frustrated and it becomes even harder to fall back asleep. I didn't pay $70 to make myself more anxious. It is exhausting and stressful. I came to dread opening the app.

Be careful when accepting "offers". The ad said 50% off for mental health awareness month and the option was to start the 7 day free trail only which would have allowed canceling with a 2 day advance reminder. Not only did I not get any 2 day notice (yes, I confirmed all email folders and found other marketing materials but none others), but when the payment was charged, I was billed full price. I feel pretty scammed.

I downloaded this app (and paid the outrageous subscription fee) to help with sleep. I have it on both my pixel phone and Samsung tablet. This app randomly "freezes" during the night (about 30% of the time) so it goes silent. Nothing more frustrating than coming back to bed after bathroom and trying to decide if it's worth totally waking myself up to RESTART the sleep app I paid for. Very disappointed üòû. a year later and couldn't be more disappointed in this app. finally purchased a machine.

I have been using ( and paying for )this app for about two years. I really do enjoy it, but it lacks some basic features to make it 5 üåü. First, they claim you can download things to listen offline, but it does not work. at least it does not work on a Samsung S24. Second, you can't sort stories by narrator. Adding this would make the app much more user friendly.

Didn't work at all. Nice stories, but didn't work. i did not want to subscribe to this app; i thought i had unsubscribed after the trial period. I was, of course, charged the year long subscription fee of $76.and some cents. i need that returned as i do live on a budget. plus, the app didnt work for me. right now the payment is pending and i unsubscribed on 5/29/25, so i hope it just retracts on its own. thank you!

I loved the app until I tried to upgrade to the family plan and they charged almost twice the amount. It was supposed to be $119. I was billed $207.47! Now I find out I have to wait 2-3 days to get an email from support to even start the support process? There isn't even chat support let alone phone. Nothing available for billing issues of this caliber is unacceptable!!!!

*3rd UPDATE*üö´Calm ‚ò†Ô∏è Ad-Adverse Buyer Beware!üßØ Nearly 3rd yr w/Calm. Liked it enough to pay üí∞. Calm isn't listeningüòµ‚Äçüí´: "PUSH" to share w/others PUSHED me to cancel ‚ùå. DONE. X 10/3/25 Finishing rest of my subscription- TECH GLITCHES STILL On top of enduring: üéÑ"Christmas üéÅ share DEAL" (til summer ‚õ±Ô∏è) üòëReplaced by aggressive "Family Offer"(NO OPTION to get rid of even if you viewed, every time you open the app that's a PUSH) üéµ NOW today a PUSH Ad on top of my music controls!üò§

They are liars. As far as I could see, the statement that some of the features of the program are free to use forever is simply a lie, unless you count opening the program and looking at the pictures, or being told to take a deep breath. But being told that tends to promote people downloading the program, which ups the download statistics. Additionally, having downloaded it, more people are likely to try the 7 day free trial, which is often forgotten about. This does not promote calmness!

There's a great variety in sleep stories, but the navigation is focused on repeating ones you've already listened to. The app also tends to crash when opening it for the first time each day, which makes it harder to choose content, which partially defeats the purpose of sleep meditations. But all in all, it's still a fairly useful sleep aid.

Long time subscriber here. I'm changing my previous rating from 5 to 1 ‚≠ê until the app gets sorted out. I noticed months ago issues that others have reported already with no bell in timed meditations or app stopping working when the screen goes blank. Also can't resume the meditation after the screen goes off because whatever was playing doesn't get paused, just stops completely - so if you were immersed in your meditation, when it stops, you can't even resume from when it stopped.

I declined to use this app and uninstalled it because I thought it was way too expensive for my needs. Yet I was charged for an annual subscription one year ago, which I didn't notice, and yet again almost double that amount this year! The app isn't even on any of my devices, it's not listed as a subscription in the play store, I haven't logged into it! I recall cancelling it, yet there is no way listed on the transaction to contact them! This is fraud! Must I cancel my card to stop your abuse!

READ the CRITICAL Reviews BEFORE you spend money for this app! According to what I've read, their so-called "free" version is just a small fraction of the full premium paid version. I tried this app again, and it's still NOT Free! Free for only 7 days, then you must pay a LOT of money. NO THANKS! UNINSTALLED! There's plenty of other better sound apps available which are free.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, We offer a free version of the app in addition to the free trial and paid subscription options. Simply tap the 'X' on any free trial or subscription offers to go back to our free app. Reach out to support@calm.com for assistance accessing the free content!

scraped_reviews.content: I listen to lofi to help me fall asleep, among other sleep sound apps. I was thrilled to find an app that combined the best of both worlds! Now, however, instead of setting a timer and having music play continuously in the background, this app stops playing after EVERY. SINGLE. SONG. Haven't used it in months and decided to give it another go, but to no avail. Still running into the same errors. Also, the volume is inconsistent between songs; some are louder than others at the same volume.

I would rate this higher, since whats there is pretty good, but WAY too much is locked behind premium. I don't make in app purchases, and I literally can't access even like 1/8 of what is available. they give you like five things you. an access and none of the daily things are available. if you get access to a series, nope it's just the first episode. I would look somewhere else if you dont want to pay

This app used to be great. They had a good layout, able to save what you wanted (with a subscription) so you could find it quickly when you needed something. I had to do this to help in times of bad agoraphobia with panic attacks. Then Calm started changing EVERYTHING and my go-to stuff I couldn't find anymore. It just became so confusing to use, even on a good day. While I understand that apps need to keep up with what users want or need, making an app too busy makes it frustrating to use.

Not worth a subscription - you can get better on Youtube. The search is poor: you cannot find what you're looking for. The interface is bad: I've had it where in a 7-day week-long series, it doesn't start on the next episode automatically (and can go back to what you listened to yesterday). And lastly it's a nightmare to try cancel subscription! Trying to do on app sends to the Google Play page, where there isn't a clear option anywhere to stop payment! Avoid!

App seems fine, but from my experience 95% of the content is locked behind their paid subscription, which was I was asked to use a "free trial" not once, but twice, and that was even before I had even got to the main menu. You're only given a very select few "options", heck even the "personalized recommendations" tab was mostly filled with locked content. Perhaps the paid version is better, but I would like to see the free version improved first.

BUYER BEWARE.... This app seems awesome. I downloaded it for the 7 day trial. After that it charges you $60 for a year. My issue is it was difficult to unsubscribe. Luckily I figured it out days ahead of time. If you don't unsubscribe more than 24 hours in advance they still charge you. Uninstalling doesn't make a difference. It's a shame. It seemed like a good app. I wish I had more time to play with it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Priscilla! We offer a free version of the app in addition to the free trial and paid subscription. Reach out to support@calm.com for assistance accessing the free content.

scraped_reviews.content: Unless you pay for the premium version, all this app becomes is a teaser trailer. Of all the multi-day guided mediations, 80% are totally locked. The other 20% only give you the first day and you must have premium to listen to the rest. Everywhere you look through the app, there are little lock symbols. You can't really do anything after the initial hype unless you pay. (For those saying "Just pay for it!" I might be getting an Apple phone in 2 months, thus blocking me from using all the apps in the Android Play Store. So I'd be throwing that $60 away.)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, if you purchase your subscription through the Google Play store and then get an iPhone our team would be happy to sync your subscription :) Reach out to support@calm.com with any additional questions.

scraped_reviews.content: The app itself is very nice. My aunt bought me a Calm puzzle that included a free month subscription, and it has lots of different things to listen to. I love listening to rain soundscapes when it's raining. But, the biggest downside is the ridiculous paywall. It's 60 dollars for this paywall to disappear (I can't remember if it's monthly or yearly) and if you have the free version, you can't access anything at all.

Yooo, I figured out how to CANCEL THE FREE TRIAL!! Ok, so I don't know if this issue is on Calm side or Google Play (I think Calm devs as there has not been a fix) but when you go to cancel, under my subscriptions, you have to scroll ALL the way to the right. The screen is super zoomed in (coding error?). You will see the word manage; Voila! Click, then move to the left and you will see the cancel subscription option. Hope this helps! And the app is good but I didn't use it enough.

A strong app, but I don't see any disclose that this app costs money to use it. I'm on a mission to stop misleading advertising and sales pitches. This is not click bait, rather bait and switch. Disclosure of fee's should be listed prior to downloading. To the person who got caught up in like-term renewals aka automatic billing. Google has an feature that lists what you bought, bought on a subscription and when that subscription ends. You can cancel anytime, but no refund.

Don't pay for this. I was lucky to earn 3 months of the paid version at no cost through another subscription. It ends this week, and I won't renew even at 40% off. You can find meditations and sounds on paid AND free versions of Spotify. The sound quality is higher, and there are options for no ads for brown noise there, even on the free version. This is overpriced for what they offer, and I find the meditations annoying and kids' stories are not appropriate and NOT sorted well.

It's a low "meh". Don' get me wrong, the soundscapes are high quality. But there was already very little in the free version and since I first got it you've moved even MORE stuff to premium. Speaking of payments, why isn't it an option to just permanently buy individual selections for a small one-time fee? I'd gladly pay for PERMANENT ACCESS to an individual item but since its premium or nothing, I've just gotta do without, which means you don't get my money. Dont you want my money? Needs work.

This app isn't special in any way. It is just simply good. The price for premium account is way too high and isn't worth it. I would not pay more than 40$ per year or probably 3.99$ a month. I enjoyed a few guided meditations. Not all narrators are good. My favorite one was with LeBron James, but the series was VERY short. The app itself is laggy and lacks perfection, it is hard to find the specific meditation you need.

I agree with previous reviews, there is very little content available for free. Also, whatever is available for free is nearly impossible to find. I literally ended up more stressed after swiping around endlessly trying to find something to help me relax. Nearly everything has a padlock symbol on it. It was pretty frustrating which defeats the purpose of why I downloaded the app in the first place. Definitely misleading, if you're not willing to pay, don't even bother.

So far I like this app a lot. There are lots of options to choose from for help with sleep, anxiety, relationship. You name it its probably on here! However the yearly subscription is a pretty big dilemma for me. I know it equals out to around $6 a month (or less) however dropping $70 at one time seems like a lot for something I cant guarentee I'm going to want to use for a full year. So just my recommendation is to make a monthly subscription rather then yearly.

Absolutely love this app! I used to have so much trouble falling asleep, but now I can put on a story and focus on my breathing and I'm asleep within the hour (a huge improvement). -1 star because it seems like they dont change out the stories often. When listening every night, you burn through them quickly! I prefer the women to the men narrators.

Good, but not enough silence. There are some great things in this app and I want to like it. The problem is they talk waayy too much during the meditations. I know they're supposed to be guiding you, but every time I would start to get my mind still, a voice would jump in and go on a minute long directive. I never finished a session without feel frustrated. I've tried many other meditation apps and this one offers the least amount of silence, which is a priority when learning to meditate.

During my free trail, I heard two pre-recorded meditations and it truly did help me relax, so I went ahead and purchased the app. Now that I've had it for over a month, I realized, there is a narrators on there who's voice I do not enjoy and I do not find particularly relaxing. This narrator, narrators majority of the meditations. I find it hard to sort through and it now takes me awhile to find a mediation without her voice.

Got to admit, it has interesting stories and sounds. The thing that annoyed me is that even when I tapped on Premium, it still didn't tell me the cost. I went in several ways to find the cost, to no avail. Any company that can't come out in front and tell us the cost, makes me wonder about its credibility! I'm not impressed that I wasn't allowed the courtesy of knowing the cost upfront, to make a financial decision without playing games.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, I'm sorry to hear you didn‚Äôt like the app! Reach out to support@calm.com if you‚Äôd like to provide additional feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: So, of the free things that are there and UI, it's cool. But because it's behind a large paywall, I don't know if I can stick with this app. 60 is too much for me since I have enough things to pay for like food and bills.... It would also be nice if you could layer over sounds that you want and at what soundblevel like what Slumber app does on iTunes. That seems more ingenious. I appreciate the passive calendar logs too but over all because of the limited stuff and high price it's not worth the anxiety (ironic)... I'll look for another free or onetime pay option...

This app helps me to remember to take just a moment during my day, whenever I feel stressed or anxious, and simply breathe, relax, and recenter my mind in the moment, on myself. I have a tendency to take on too much and then get overwhelmed. This small, intentional gesture reminds me that if I try to do too much at once, or think about too much at once, all things I attempt will be impacted negatively.

I've been using the "free" version since the beginning of this year and I enjoy it. I was reading another comment where someone said the speakers speak to slowly...I think the speed that they talk in is fine for trying to fall to sleep. Would I see myself paying full price...I can't say because the free options are good but I don't think they are tempting enough for me to make that commitment. I do believe that the free options are nice-your trying to fall asleep/meditate- not active listening

There is a wide variety of content, but the quality is rather low. They have a big focus on daily content, which leads to ideas feeling more forced, which feels distracting. I really like the guided movements, but I find the bedtime stories and celebrity content annoying. Longer, more involved courses are harder to find and feel shallow or awkwardly-paced. If you're looking for better meditations, I'd recommend 10 percent happier. Calm is a decent, cheaper option.

The app worked well for about two months. Then it stopped syncing (I had a good signal). I reinstalled, logged off, cleared data ... Couldn't log back in. Couldn't even create a new account. "Forgot password" didn't work. Now I question the timing of at least 10 phishing emails that suddenly appeared. So glad I had opted for the free version.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Cindy, I'm sorry for the trouble! Reach out to support@calm.com and we'd be happy to help you out.

scraped_reviews.content: I usually love calm, but lately my experience been bad. I started using the soundscapes with timer about 1 week ago to sleep at night.. It worked for the first couple of days. Now it randomly stops every half hour, despite an eight hour timer set, to give me the "well done" message. Not good, not good at all. Please fix it asap or I will need to cancel my subscription.

Overpriced and poor trial notifications. Tried it out once. Not really what I was looking for. Trial said it would notify you before charging. Completely forgot about it, didn't receive any reminders, thanks for the false reassurances, and got charged a yearly $70 membership. Seems like they are feeding on the people who forget. That was an expensive mistake.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, I'm so sorry for the unintended charge. Reach out to support@calm.com and we'd be happy to assist you!

scraped_reviews.content: Tried to sign up for the 7 day free trial so I could take a look at the full version and see what it was like. I started the free trial, and everything was still locked. I tried closing the app and reopening it, nothing. I ended up cancelling the subscription thinking maybe I could try again, but now the only option is the $60 yearly charge which seems like a lot for something like this. I would totally pay for monthly access, but that's a lot of money to put down on an app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Karis, I'm sorry for the trouble! Reach out to support@calm.com and we'd be happy to help you out.

scraped_reviews.content: WAIT!!! DO **NOT** DO A 7-DAY FREE TRIAL!!! They take the money. So if you do a 7-day free trial and end up clicking on the year long subscription, they charge you THAT DAY, not 7 days later after your free trial. After they charged me, I didn't want to go through the hassle of trying to get my money back so I kept the year long subscription, and the app is great! The stories are perfection, etc etc. But it really sucked that they took the money when they weren't supposed to.

Love this app, but, received a coupon for 25% off premium subscription with 3 months free service, It's not stated, but the app offers additional free days, 7 after you sign up for the premium, I'm not sure if that free time is in additions, but it should be, as that is how it's advertised. I followed the link and signed up, after 7 days I was charged the full amount.  The developer did not honor the discount.  Fortunately I used PayPal and will initiate a dispute, if it can't be resolved, I will have to look for another app, or go without. I'm not going to support a dishonest developer. And neither should anyone else.  Response to:"Unfortunately, we're not able to honor discounts on in-app purchases.."  Was not an in-app purchase. It was an email offer from the dev, offered before I activated the free 7 day premium service.  I followed the link while using my desktop email program, followed the directions and ended up getting charged full amount, then told that I didn't follow the directions. Instead of honoring the discount THEY refunded my money and cancel my subscription. Not the response I was expecting considering the intent of their app,  bottom line, they don't care.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately, we're not able to honor discounts on in-app purchases, as the subscription is through Google Play. That discount needed to be taken advantage through our website. For additional clarification please reach out to support@calm.com!

scraped_reviews.content: I honestly love this app. Its very easy to use and always is a great reminder to take a deep breath. I use it fairly often at work since I'm in an open office environment and sometimes need a sound buffer. I also often use it to calm down before sleeping. The only things preventing me from giving 5 stars are: - I'm sure they're working on this but more music options would be great (perhaps genre related - like classical). - More things read by Stephen Fry ; )

Unlike most apps with in app purchases, this one only gives you one free sample, once download. Almost everything is an in app purchase. You can't even get a sample of each activity or story. There's not even anything here to hook you into it. On top of that, it's $49 usd per month if you decide to go premium. If most people don't even pay for Spotify why would you pay for this? Don't waste your time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi John, sounds like you are having trouble accessing the free content, reach out to support at support@calm.com and we‚Äôd be happy to guide you to it.

title: Fitify: Fitness, Home Workout

However, we also include workouts and training plans with equipment and tools such as: ‚Ä¢ Kettlebell ‚Ä¢ TRX ‚Ä¢ Bosu ‚Ä¢ Swiss Ball ‚Ä¢ Medicine Ball ‚Ä¢ Resistance Band ‚Ä¢ Dumbbell ‚Ä¢ Barbell ‚Ä¢ Foam Roller ‚Ä¢ Pull-Up Bar Fitify is your ultimate full-body workout app for bodyweight training, whether you're at home or in the gym. With over 900 exercises in the app, your daily workout plans are always fresh, fun, and challenging. Work out anywhere, anytime using any fit tool. No equipment required, but if you have one ‚Äì take advantage of it! What can we do for you? ‚Ä¢ Personalized fitness plan - custom training plan based on your experience, goal, and time options. Each workout routine is created based on your personal fitness level to get you the best results. ‚Ä¢ 15 minutes daily workouts ‚Ä¢ over 900 bodyweight & fit tools exercises - so the workout is always fun, unique, and effective ‚Ä¢ 20+ prebuilt workouts - choose body part, type of training and duration ‚Ä¢ 15+ prebuilt recovery sessions - Stretching, Yoga, and Foam Rolling sessions ‚Ä¢ ability to build your own ‚ÄúCustom workout‚Äù from our huge exercise database ‚Ä¢ works offline ‚Ä¢ voice coach ‚Ä¢ clear HD video demonstrations Fitness Plans ‚Ä¢ Weekly training plan full of Workout and Recovery sessions ‚Ä¢ Workouts only take 15-25 minutes to complete. ‚Ä¢ HIIT, Tabata, Strength Trainings, Cardio and Recovery sessions with easy-to-follow video exercises. ‚Ä¢ See history and track your awesome progress! Strength: ‚Ä¢ Fullbody Workout ‚Ä¢ Insane Six Pack ‚Ä¢ Complex Core ‚Ä¢ Strong Back ‚Ä¢ Complex Lower Body ‚Ä¢ Explosive Power Jumps ‚Ä¢ Amazing Butt ‚Ä¢ Complex Upper Body ‚Ä¢ Arm Blaster ‚Ä¢ Monster Chest ‚Ä¢ Shoulders & Upper Back HIIT & Cardio ‚Ä¢ High Intensity (HIIT) ‚Ä¢ Light Cardio (LISS) ‚Ä¢ Tabata ‚Ä¢ Cardio-Strength Intervals ‚Ä¢ Plyometrics ‚Ä¢ Joint Friendly Special ‚Ä¢ Warm-Up ‚Ä¢ Cool Down ‚Ä¢ Balance & Coordination ‚Ä¢ Scientific 7 minutes ‚Ä¢ Functional workout ‚Ä¢ Fullbody training Recovery Sessions ‚Ä¢ Full Body Stretching ‚Ä¢ Upper Body Stretching ‚Ä¢ Back Stretching ‚Ä¢ Lower Body Stretching ‚Ä¢ Full Body Flexibility Yoga ‚Ä¢ Yoga for Runners ‚Ä¢ Yoga for Healthy Back ‚Ä¢ Morning Yoga ‚Ä¢ Yoga for Sleep ‚Ä¢ Full body Foam Rolling ‚Ä¢ Legs Foam Rolling ‚Ä¢ Back Foam Rolling ‚Ä¢ Neck Foam Rolling Workout Builder Workout builder feature is available by default so your fitness routine is never the same. descriptionHTML:
Who needs a gym? Get in shape at home with Workouts & Plans from Fitify.

You can work out using only bodyweight training (no equipment!). However, we also include workouts and training plans with equipment and tools such as:
‚Ä¢ Kettlebell
‚Ä¢ TRX
‚Ä¢ Bosu
‚Ä¢ Swiss Ball
‚Ä¢ Medicine Ball
‚Ä¢ Resistance Band
‚Ä¢ Dumbbell
‚Ä¢ Barbell
‚Ä¢ Foam Roller
‚Ä¢ Pull-Up Bar

Fitify is your ultimate full-body workout app for bodyweight training, whether you're at home or in the gym. With over 900 exercises in the app, your daily workout plans are always fresh, fun, and challenging. Work out anywhere, anytime using any fit tool. No equipment required, but if you have one ‚Äì take advantage of it!

What can we do for you?
‚Ä¢ Personalized fitness plan - custom training plan based on your experience, goal, and time options. Each workout routine is created based on your personal fitness level to get you the best results.
‚Ä¢ 15 minutes daily workouts
‚Ä¢ over 900 bodyweight & fit tools exercises - so the workout is always fun, unique, and effective
‚Ä¢ 20+ prebuilt workouts - choose body part, type of training and duration
‚Ä¢ 15+ prebuilt recovery sessions - Stretching, Yoga, and Foam Rolling sessions
‚Ä¢ ability to build your own ‚ÄúCustom workout‚Äù from our huge exercise database
‚Ä¢ works offline
‚Ä¢ voice coach
‚Ä¢ clear HD video demonstrations


Fitness Plans
‚Ä¢ Weekly training plan full of Workout and Recovery sessions
‚Ä¢ Workouts only take 15-25 minutes to complete.
‚Ä¢ HIIT, Tabata, Strength Trainings, Cardio and Recovery sessions with easy-to-follow video exercises.
‚Ä¢ See history and track your awesome progress!

Custom Workout Routines
Blend your own workout from our beast database of over 900 exercises.

Standalone Workouts
Whether you go bodyweight or use a tool like Kettlebell, you can choose to follow a plan or run any of our prebuilt workouts. Choose body part, type of training, duration. That‚Äôs it.

Strength:
‚Ä¢ Fullbody Workout
‚Ä¢ Insane Six Pack
‚Ä¢ Complex Core
‚Ä¢ Strong Back
‚Ä¢ Complex Lower Body
‚Ä¢ Explosive Power Jumps
‚Ä¢ Amazing Butt
‚Ä¢ Complex Upper Body
‚Ä¢ Arm Blaster
‚Ä¢ Monster Chest
‚Ä¢ Shoulders & Upper Back

HIIT & Cardio
‚Ä¢ High Intensity (HIIT)
‚Ä¢ Light Cardio (LISS)
‚Ä¢ Tabata
‚Ä¢ Cardio-Strength Intervals
‚Ä¢ Plyometrics
‚Ä¢ Joint Friendly

Special
‚Ä¢ Warm-Up
‚Ä¢ Cool Down
‚Ä¢ Balance & Coordination
‚Ä¢ Scientific 7 minutes
‚Ä¢ Functional workout
‚Ä¢ Fullbody training

Recovery Sessions
‚Ä¢ Full Body Stretching
‚Ä¢ Upper Body Stretching
‚Ä¢ Back Stretching
‚Ä¢ Lower Body Stretching
‚Ä¢ Full Body Flexibility Yoga
‚Ä¢ Yoga for Runners
‚Ä¢ Yoga for Healthy Back
‚Ä¢ Morning Yoga
‚Ä¢ Yoga for Sleep
‚Ä¢ Full body Foam Rolling
‚Ä¢ Legs Foam Rolling
‚Ä¢ Back Foam Rolling
‚Ä¢ Neck Foam Rolling

Workout Builder
Workout builder feature is available by default so your fitness routine is never the same. Each workout is fresh and fun so you're still motivated on your fitness journey.

The download and usage of Fitify is free of charge. Get your training plan and extra features with the Pro version, which is available on a subscription basis. You can always cancel the subscription here in Google Play/Subscriptions. When you cancel, access to the Pro features will expire at the end of the current payment period. There is no increase in price when renewing. We provide 10 days money-back warranty.

Also check out our brand new app for Wear OS devices!

Contact: support@gofitify.com
Website: https://GoFitify.com

Thanks for reading to the end. Thanks for keeping yourself fit with us üíôüí™
summary: Your personal workout app. Workout routines & training plan at home.

scraped_reviews.content: This may be the first workout app I haven't gotten bored with in the 1st few weeks. Not only have I seen results, but some days, I can't wait to see the next workout. Currently, I've been following the plan the app set up for me, and so far, I've lost 8lbs and several inches on my waist. I like the personalization of the app and how it's tailored to your specific goal and fitness level. This app has customizable workouts, an AI fitness coach, and tasty recipes that are really good. Great app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Shanise, thanks so much for your kind words! üíö We‚Äôre really happy to hear you‚Äôre enjoying the workouts, seeing results, and finding the app engaging. Keep up the amazing progress ‚Äî and we‚Äôll keep working hard to bring you even more personalized workouts, tasty recipes, and motivating features! Stay fit! Lucie, team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: Everything was good, exercise, voice, time, and different choices of exercise the only thing that they don't have, is a choice of languages. And if they have it where do I go to change or choose my preference? I went to settings and apps and did my part and nothing happened. HELP!! They choose the language that they want...very disappointed, I'm also trying to cancel my subscription and they make it impossible to do. üòû I'M DONE WITH THIS!!!

Do not use this app. Its an angler fish. Not even worth 1 dollar. App plans give you "30 minute work outs" that are 3 rounds of doing 15 seperate exercises with completely different pieces of equipment. There is no way to minimize it. This app does not respect your wallet or your time. Then they charge you 20 dollars for Ai scans but then the feature doesn't work at all and doesn't upload your scans. Very scummy and predatory app.

Save your money. Free version may be suitable for basic use. Glaring issues to contend with while working out... Randomness of the exercises for warm up and workouts some times don't make any sense. Intervals between exercises (especially with equipment) doesn't allow for getting set up. Clearly the developers never worked out before. No tracking of sets or weights. Doesn't sync to watches, or Google Fit, or whatever the samsung app is. AI is worthless. Don't waste the $70.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Chris, thank you for your detailed feedback. We‚Äôre sorry the app didn‚Äôt meet your expectations. Please contact us at support@gofitify.com, we‚Äôll be happy to review your setup and see how we can improve your experience. Stay fit! Lucie, team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app. Workouts are short and somewhat customisable based on your equipment. The rating of the workout is simple and not time consuming. AI coach is good. However, there are significant drawbacks: - Can't filter workouts based on body area, even doing a standalone workout outside personalised program. - Future workouts are influenced by workout and rating but if forgot, can't go back to rate. - Language is sometimes Portuguese, sometimes English. Can't recommend to English friends.

So far so good. Still in my first week and the exercises challenge me enough while also not pushing me too hard. Some feedback - I wish I could reorder the exercises list so all my ground work is in a clump and I don't have to get up and down a bunch of times. It doesn't happen all the time, but often enough. I also wish I could add a few extra seconds transition time after some exercises, as I am still getting back up off the floor (see above). Overall happy with it, though.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Melissa, thank you for your feedback ‚Äî we‚Äôre happy to hear you‚Äôre enjoying your workouts and finding them well balanced. We‚Äôll note your suggestions about reordering exercises and adding more transition time! We‚Äôd be glad to hear more from you at support@gofitify.com. Best! Lucie, team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: I paid for this app expecting to create custom workouts and track my progress properly, including the weights I lift. Shockingly, there's no way to enter or log weights at all, a basic feature for anyone serious about training. Without the ability to track load or progression, this feels like a glorified timer with preset routines. For a paid app, this is a huge letdown. Save your money and look elsewhere if you care about actual strength training or progress tracking.

This app is really good if you want a visual guide for exercises but I personally just wish it had more toggles and more stuff in the free version. Like a detailed tracking of your exercises and a rating of whether your workout is healthy or not. I'd also be happy if you could adjust the times for warm ups and the mode whether it will be generally considered hard, easy or medium. Sorry if this review made no sense, I am trying to get better at the way I explain things. Overall I love this appüòÅ

Most fitness apps are not free, neither is this one. Description says it is a free app. After spending the time to make a profile with all the usual gender, age, weight, height and 101 questions about what you want to achieve, eat, how you want to workout and your cousins baby daddy, you get to the goods (at least you think). Everything is locked...until you pay the fee...for the free app. I guess the app is free but everything in it is not...just like all the other fitness apps! Rrrr!

I really love this app. I lost 10lbs in one month but I'm also doing a calories deficit along with the workouts that this app gives me. The only thing that bothers me about this app is that the AI coach, it deletes messages everyday, even messages where you ask it questions about certain workouts or diets etc., more or less, the important stuff that I might need to go back to. But it's always gone. That's what bothers me. Other than that, I still give it 5 stars.

Good app but hope to see it get better. The workout selection is great, but each exercise is usually 30 seconds long. I would like an option to choose any length. In the custom workouts I can choose a length, but no custom average lengths for generated workouts. A favorite folder where I can easily add workouts to would be nice. The app has no cable machine workouts. It also doesn't have parallel bars, or gymnastics ring workouts. Overall a great app that will hopefully get better.

This app makes you jump between excercises in cycles, instead of grouping all excercises of each type together. This means you'll spend more time adjusting your weights than actually working out. It's ok if you have at least an hours for a workout, and you don't mind putting weights on and off. Update: I reduce it to 1 star because I sent two emails to the developers and got no response for over a month now. For a paid app it should be better.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Uri, thank you for reaching out. If there is any issue with your workout settings, just email us at support@gofitify.com, We‚Äôd be happy to help and check your workout settings to ensure you have the best training experience üíöüí™ Stay fit! Team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: Well! I'm a 43 yo M fitness buff. I've been using bodyweight, pull-up bar, and dumbells for years. This app taught me new ways to use what I already have. It syncs to Google fit. You can start creating only one custom workout "right out of the box". You can use this app and your favorite music app at the same time with a Bluetooth speaker\headphones. The free version is very limited, so I'll be switching back to one of my old apps that I only had to pay once for.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks a lot Todd! Amazing review, happy to help you finding some fun with your equipment :) 
Thanks for your feedback!
Martin, CEO at Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: I LOVE it. select exercise , equipment to use and position , standing or on the floor. I love to use kettlebell standing so i just go in and find the ones.I LOVE that there are video demo of the exercises and there is a preview of the exercise. i get rest time so i dont feel like i am dying. The ability to customize so many aspect of my workout is a game changer.. Con: I would love if there was an image showing the muscle groups being work so I know I selected the correct exercise.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Hadia,
Thanks a lot for the feedback! There will be description of muscle groups involved and common mistakes soon :) üí™
Stay fit and keep working out with us üíô

scraped_reviews.content: by far one of the better fitness apps I've used! the AI technology is quite helpful and is used appropriately.. the exercise regimen is customizable, and it allows you to adjust what you do in each exercise. easy to follow. also has recipes and mindfulness exercises to follow. overall, I am glad I am using this because it really is helping me stay on track and looking forward to each workout!! I highly recommend it to anyone who is new to fitness or is intimidated to begin working out.

I'm enjoying it. Definitely one of the better apps I've tried, HOWEVER, I do wish they allowed to change a workout for a similar alternative. I don't have the best knees and I even selected that on their app. Most workouts are great but a few are hard on my knees and I can't switch them. I want to workout and not skip a part. On top if mentioning my bad knees I also gave those workouts a thumbs down and I'm still getting them!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Reyna, thank you for reaching out. We'd be happy to help with your workout settings to ensure you have the best training experience, just email us at support@gofitify.com üíöüí™ Stay fit! Team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: The ability to select what equipment I have at home and have a workout program built around that is fantastic! I've been looking for this style of workout app for ever and I'm so lucky i found it! Workouts are engaging and easy to follow. Some people complain about the going back and forth to grab different equipment but I preview the workout to gauge what I need. Plus if it's that much of a hassle you can pause it to get adjusted. If you have any doubts about this app, please don't, it's üíØ

I love this app so far. I came from the body building world, but initially started doing gymnastics. I lost a lot of mobility so this app is really helping me gain it back. My knowledge was also limited on body weight exercises. I'm learning different movements for different parts of the body and I love it. I've eliminated weight training completely for pure calisthenics and cross training and this app is a major factor. Love the equipment variants too. The only thing I wish was different is yoga for beginners with different progressions. 5 stars from a premium user.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for the support Trey! üôè
Click "Too hard" after the yoga session and the next session will be slightly easier (but there is a space for improvement definitelly-we will add more beginner poses) :)
Stay fit üí™
Martin

scraped_reviews.content: This app is awesome because it includes pre-made workouts, and you have the option to customize it, as well. The app has cardio, dumbbell training, resistance band training, and body weight options. There's also yoga, and stretching. Best of all, you only need this app and the equipment you already have. This is great for beginners, as well as more intermediate fitness levels. No gym required.

Seems like it's maybe a great app but no free trial limits options considerably. Most workouts, features and options are Pro and you can't even sample them without purchasing. Also, there's an AI fit coach that seems pretty interesting but evidently you're extremely limited on what you can ask it. I had two 30 second conversations with it and was cut off before my second message was sent on the second convo. No warning, just put on page with a bunch of purchase options. Pay first then try? No TY

Trainer Glen is excellent! he's the reason I'm really sticking with it this time. I've been using the app for a few years now, and I don't notice any new material. the recorded exercises were never complete to begin with, and I expected that they would be filling in the gaps, adding new modalities, and adding new pieces of equipment, like Indian clubs, clubbells and macebells I've been paying all the money but I haven't seen anything new in a long time. please tighten the game and add new stuff

In theory, this could be a great app ... I like that I can punch in the equipment I've available to me & the variation. But ultimately the app just spits out hiit / crossfit style workouts. The pace, the lack of repetition of the same exercises (some require a lot of strength & coordination), is a recipe for injury. Unless you have decent experience with hiit/crossfit, or the time to put in to watch the youtube videos you'll need to learn proper technique, I don't recommend this app.

Looking for a new app with free services, this one had a ton of downloads (so it must be good right?) however, after taking my body metric data, assessment data, email address, and personal name I hit pay wall. Granted it seems relatively cheap something like $30-$60 depending on plan, it wasn't as low cost as I was looking for. Not transparent, as it takes all your data and info first then hits you with a pay wall to use it's advertised services, because of this I do not recommend it.

Clean, well developed app. The workouts are great and the plans are very reasonably priced. I wish you could remove or change the exercises in the app. Some of the exercises are impossible to do in my environment, some just aggravate old injuries. I'd like to swap them out for a different exercise for the same muscle.

I've been using Fitify for three weeks now. It's amazing! I've lost 8lbs with a combo of eating well. I workout about five or six days a week doing a minimum of 30min session and a max session of 45 minutes. The exercise are intense to keep you fit and lose weight as well. Whatever your goal is, this app has it all. 100% recommend for starters and advanced users like myself. Good luck!

Awesome app if you want to start losing weight. I really like how it's structured with time rather than reps. It gives you an opportunity to build up rather having to hit a rep goal which can be discouraging if you're exhausted. And the subscription price is very cheap when you see how much the app offers. 11/7/19 Reviewing again and the app only got more awesome after the latest updates! Need a space to save weight when doing dumbbells and kettlebells!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much Shannon! Nice to hear that :) Stay fit üíôüôè

scraped_reviews.content: I came back to lower my review by one star. After a few weeks I feel like the workouts are way too easy. Some of the exercises, like kettle bell figure eights, I can do a who tabata set while barely raising my heart rate. The app is good if you're out of shape and looking for something to get started, but you can't really push the limit with it. Edit: Now it loses two stars because it doesn't let you view the other workout plans without losing your progress.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Matthew, thank you for reaching out! Fitify estimates your fitness level based on the questions we give you at the beginning. This is quite easy to solve, just tell the app the workout was too easy, and it will make your next workout harder :) I respect your opinion, but we think that its good to focus on a current plan! :) Stay fit! Lucie

scraped_reviews.content: Downloaded from an Instagram ad that said was a 30 day trail. Was charged immediately. I went to refund and Google Play and PayPal refuse to refund. Very scammy and a waste of $75. If you want to try it out make sure you only select monthly subscription so you don't lose too much money if you want to cancel. Overall it is a decent fitness app, I just wish it would recommend and set weight goals and tiers for workouts when using dumbells. Just didn't fully fit my needs.

Their 30-day no quibble guarantee is worthless.....I took out a subscription on the basis that there was a 30-day no quibble money back guarantee. However when I contacted support (25 days after giving the app a good tryout & didn't like it), they told me I had to contact Google for any refund. Google of course declined the refund, presumably because I've had the app for quite a while (Google most probably know nothing about Fitify's 30 day money back guarantee). HONOUR YOUR GUARANTEE.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jez, we‚Äôve just checked with our support team and it looks like everything has already been resolved ‚Äî your payment was refunded. We‚Äôre really sorry if there was any confusion about the process. If there‚Äôs anything else we can help with, just let us know ‚Äî we‚Äôre happy to assist! Lucie, Team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: I've come to like this app more and more. I first started using it 2 or 3 times a week at the gym instead of the hamster wheels for the fat burning Plyometrics and HIIT training. Once the gym was stripped away I started using it for my total workout. You can customize their programed workouts with the equipment you have. Now, I am have a ankle injury. I can create my own programmed workout from their library of exercise. It's really awesome. Oh and all this is free. Upgrades are available too

Enjoy using this app as it not only builds my workout but also holds me accountable! The voice over isn't anoying and is compatible with music apps. Only reason it did not get 5 stars is because I wish there were some free weight workout options. Also hope the future updates bring ability to write in how much weight/ reps you got to see progress.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Clairesse,
We are already working on Dumbbell and Barbell workouts :)
We also have plans on adding a feature to see the progress better!
Enjoy our app üíô
Martin, CEO at Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: It's amazing how a fitness app does the introduction so horribly, step one, enter your bodily information, then pick your days and they have you tap a little bubble to 'signify your commitment' and immediately after ask for you to pay an amount weekly after either zero or extremely brief mention of it. Scummy, and really manipulative, you should not have to rely on guilt for cash, and most certainly not in that order, be up front.

you get little to no content on the free version. it's instantly throwing multiple pop ups in my face to upgrade to pro when I haven't even done 1 workout yet. 99% of the plans and workouts are locked behind a pay wall. it doesn't offer any free trials, or anything that gives you time to experience the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Alec, Fitify is a freemium app, which means you can enjoy many workouts for free! To access personalized training plans, you have to get the premium membership. However, there are plenty of great workouts available in the "Workouts" section, you should give it a try! If you have any questions, let us know at support@gofitify.com üíöüí™Team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: i am regretting my purchase on this app. Some of the apps is ok such as the AI coach and the vudeo instructions are good. What really lets it down though is when doing any activity with weights it provides bo suggestions as to how much weight. There is also no way to record what you used and then again no suggestions then to what to increase too. I feel.this is really important for people beginning and are not sure what they should be doing. You are also not able to really select any equipment.

I found this app awhile ago and it worked ok, but I lost access when my phone was stolen & have jus returned. you were previously able to add any injuries/weak areas & allergies so that the workouts & recipes could be adjusted, this longer seems to be a saved feature. - if there is still a way to save this in the free version of the app, I will be willing to change my rating. The app also used to have a much wider range of free workouts and features which you now have to be a paid user for.

I am currently learning German and have installed a German keyboard on my Android device. As a result, the app now launches in German, presumably detecting the keyboard layout as an indicator of my preferred language. I navigated to the language settings in Android and switching to English (UK), followed by restarting both my phone and the app. Unfortunately, the app remains in German, with no apparent option to adjust the language manually. More to say here, but no space. Deleted the app.

I have never been a willing exerciser. I had physical jobs and decided that was enough. I've tried gyms, really didn't get into it. Fitify has me exercising willingly and on a program. Fitify took note of my age, and previous injuries in setting up an achievable program. I'm really enjoying the program and I'm feeling better after only one week. I'm looking forward to building to being fitter than I've ever been. Thank you Fitify.

I found the app confusing and not worth the money. The exercises were not changing day to day. I wanted to work different muscle groups and the app just kept repeating the routine from the day before. I stopped using the app and went to a different one.

It really pays to do your homework on this app. I found it did not deliver what was suggested in the description and comments. I paid for 3 months and now there is no refund from either the developer or Google. Disappointing but lesson learned about apps that don't offer a free trial period.

It is a great product. The only hiccup is that some transitions are too fast and it's hard to be ready when the timer starts. e.g. restarting a round. I have to hit PAUSE. It's also missing demonstrations to properly do an exercise, like RDLs, to avoid injury. Besides that, it's a good app. better than the gym classes.

So far, I'm loving the app. The workouts are the perfect intensity for me. I wish during the workout the AI would not only mention the name of the exercise but also tell me how many reps or seconds I need to do the move for. That way I wouldn't have to keep looking at the screen at the start of each exercise.

Extremely limited number of free workouts. Workouts available have no audio descriptions of the exercises involved, so you have to stop the workout to figure out what you're doing. Text decriptions are also copy and pasted between moves with no explanation of the difference between them. This is an AI cash grab.

It's nice that you can at least see what's there (after making an account of course...) but everything is locked down and it's a very steep subscription. it would be nice if they just advertised it as a paid app with a preview option, because it's most certainly not free.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, Fitify is a freemium app, which means you can enjoy many workouts for free! To access personalized training plans, you have to get the premium membership. However, there are plenty of great workouts available in the "Workouts" section, you should give it a try! If you have any questions, let us know at support@gofitify.com üíöüí™Team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: I justvstarted a desk job so I'm not moving around as much as I used to. I installed this app to try and do some daily movements to keep myself from gaining weight but some of the workouts are difficult to do. I didn't find this app with the money

they give 23 exercises after which it will be repeated 3 times each ...to acquire each position take some time. this all in 40 min exercise duration. so you can imagine how impractical it is to fit in so many positions and do all the repeats and set. i even wrote in their chat but there was no improvement. so it is inferior app. money waste.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, we‚Äôre sorry to hear the workouts felt repetitive. Our goal is to provide training that adapts to your needs, and feedback like yours helps us improve. If you‚Äôd like, please reach out to us at support@gofitify.com with more details so we can take a closer look and find a better setup for you üíöStay fit! Lucie, team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: The concept is great, but the workouts are very basic. I played around with settings to up the intensity, extend the workout period, and incorporate equipment such as dumbells, but you barely break a sweat. You do not burn anywhere near the calories stated, and most days, it felt as though I hadn't worked out at all. I'd say a beginner friendly app at most and not for those with a good base line of fitness. I needed something a little more challenging.

99% of the features are locked behind a subscription. The "individual plan" is not available without it as well, so the test in the beginning is a waste of your time. All you have for free are like one or two most basic training plans in each section. The video explanations and info about your exercises are included and are easy to understand, that's one plus. They shove the subscription right in your face tho, all the time, even in notifications. Absolute rip-off.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, Fitify is a freemium app, which means you can enjoy many workouts for free! To access personalized training plans, you have to get the premium membership. However, there are plenty of great workouts available in the "Workouts" section, you should give it a try! If you have any questions, let us know at support@gofitify.com üíöüí™Team Fitify

scraped_reviews.content: For a few days straight the app made me do 8-10 chair squats each day. It lacked variation and there is no option to replace one exercise with the other. The AI feature is not very useful either. Will unsubscribe when the current subscription ends.

Generally good, but the AI is useless. It pays no heed to the feedback on individual workouts after a session. When I put that split squats were painful, it just included them again in the next workout but also added lunges and twisted lunges, which are the same movement but more difficult. the pain from attempting this last workout almost made me give up completely. When I mentioned this to the AI trainer, it said there's no way to remove exercises that are actually painful. Do better devs!

at first I was hoping to pay as little as possible for an app when I could just work out for free on YouTube. but then I got into the app and I saw everything it came with. the AI body imaging which gave me an almost accurate measurement of each part of my body as well as telling me my mass index lean versus fat. then I started my workout and it was intense but I loved how specific it was. It was tailored to the parts of my body that I want to actually work out.

title: Adobe Express: AI Photo, Video
description:
Adobe Express is the quick and easy app to create on-brand content that helps your business stand out and make an impact. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned creator, Adobe Express empowers you and your team to make high-quality marketing and business materials while maintaining brand consistency.

VIDEO MADE EASY
Looking for the best free video editor? Adobe Express makes video editing simple. Use customizable templates, upload clips from your gallery, trim and combine footage, add text, music, transitions, and sound effects. Automatically add captions, reframe for social channels, and remove background noise -- all in one place.

PHOTO EDITING FOR EVERYONE
Adobe Express is the best free photo editor for beginners, offering intuitive tools to enhance your images. Use AI to add or remove objects, apply Photoshop-powered filters, and instantly generate stunning photo art with our AI photo generator.

BYE-BYE BACKGROUNDS
Need the best app to remove photo backgrounds? Adobe Express makes it effortless. With Quick Actions, remove backgrounds from photos or videos in seconds, convert images to GIFs, and resize content with a single tap.

QR CODE GENERATION MADE SIMPLE
Create stylish, branded QR codes with ease. Adobe Express is your best QR code generator online, offering customizable styles and colors to match your brand.

STAYING ON BRAND MADE EASY
With brand kits, keep your fonts, colors, and logos ready to drop into any design. Apply your brand across all your content with a tap. Maintain a cohesive look with Generate Similar and refine designs.

EDIT PDFs QUICKLY
Update content, swap images, refine layouts, or add your brand‚Äôs colors, fonts, and visuals, all in just a few clicks. You can even convert files to PDF or export PDFs to share with your team or audience instantly.

QUICK ACTION TOOLS 
¬∑ Trim & resize designs for any channel
¬∑ Crop photos & convert image files
¬∑ Convert to GIF from images & videos
¬∑ Animate a character with your voice
¬∑ Import PDF
Some features are not currently supported on all devices, but good things are coming. Support for more devices is rolling out over time.

QUESTIONS? 
Your feedback and engagement will help us make Adobe Express better for everyone. 
Join our Discord community 
[https://discord.gg/adobeexpress] to share your thoughts, connect with the community and get involved with creative challenges 
Visit Uservoice [https://adobeexpress.uservoice.com/forums/951181-adobe-express] to request new features 
Let us know about any bugs or issues you encounter in our Adobe Community Forum [https://community.adobe.com/t5/adobe-express/ct-p/ct-adobe-express] 

PREMIUM MEMBERSHIP 
Your Adobe Express Premium membership unlocks access to Premium features: 
¬∑ Over 200M royalty-free Adobe Stock photos, videos, music tracks, design elements and fonts 
¬∑ 250 generative credits to generate images, templates and more  
¬∑ Remove Video Background, One-click Resize for multiple channels, brand kits and more 
Use your Adobe Express Premium plan across your desktop browser and mobile phone. Also includes Adobe Photoshop Express on mobile. 
Please refer to our full terms of service for more details. [http://www.adobe.com/go/terms_en] 

Terms and conditions: 
Your use of this Adobe application is governed by the Adobe General Terms of Use http://www.adobe.com/go/terms_en, and Adobe Privacy Policy http://www.adobe.com/go/privacy_policy_en and any successor versions thereto. 

Do not sell or share my personal information: www.adobe.com/go/ca-rights 

All trademarks are the property of their respective owners.
