summary: Beat maker, music maker, song maker‚Ä¶ you name it! Create music now.

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely love the app - how it lets you create music easily, with many harmonies and melodies and tracks to choose from. I love how you can record your own music and add it in to your songs, and how you can adjust each part's volume and everything! The one and only problem I have is that the songs I've already made and saved to my account aren't able to be automatically transferred when I switch devices. I had to redo my favorite songs all the way just to transfer them between devices. I don't tend to upload a lot of my songs, but I would REALLY appreciate it if my songs could automatically transfer between devices when linked to my account. I feel that I've lost a lot of my good projects because of this. Please fix and I'll give this app the 5 stars it really deserves!

The app is overall really good. However, I have one small complaint. Sometimes, whenever I make a recording, that recording replaces another existing one. And when I delete the recording, the replaced recording also gets deleted. I'm not entirely sure what's going on, but I hope you will hear me out and fix this dilemma. Thank you for your time.

It's fun and easy. It does put a little strain on the resources of the device it's loaded on. Save your progress often in case the app blows a gasket and reboots. I listen to the same loop several zillion times to get a handle on weather it rings true to the ear. The more sound pool samples you buy the more you'll want to test the "flavor" of each. If your machine is new and has gobs of memory and a slick cpu, this tunesmith app is for you. Oh, God. I'm rhyming the review.

No dude, i spent almost $10 worth of beat coins on this app man, I tried making an account to save my mix packs and such, but for some reason there is some kind of error. When i try logging in, i get the same error, then i tried remaking my account but there was a problem sayingmy email was taken. I didnt think too much about this problem until now. I had 7 Mix packs including the starters. I opened the app today and all of them were gone except the starters. I spent almost TEN DOLLARS. all gone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Fusion -X, 

Thanks for your feedback. Did you already send an email to support@justaddmusic.net? This way we can help you as best as possible.

Thanks,
Your JAM team

scraped_reviews.content: It would be nicer if you can add extra scarier sound effects instead of just one Halloween Sound Pack. Also, please be sure not to have original comments erased without any reason. On the flipside, currently dealing with Music Maker Jam freezing each time I create an instrumental, but when it comes to myself recording, it automatically plays. Technical difficulties.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are encountering with an freezing issue. Simply email us at support@loudly.com and we‚Äôd be happy to help you resolve the issue.
Your MMJ team

scraped_reviews.content: Pretty decent app with a great deal of potential, but somewhat limited. The only musical key available is C major/A minor, which means that any chord not naturally in that key is not available to use. Consequently, more than half of all existing musical chords aren't available for use, and this is only when considering basic triads formed from the diatonic scales. Allowing more musical freedom and not limiting the number of available chords would exponentially improve this app.

This app is awesome for on the go music mixing. The prices of each jam session keeps me from a 5 because I have a lot of magix products on the pc and bought at lower costs. But I show this off all the time. Edit: still keeping a 4 but wanted to add the prices got matched on pc. The only thing I wish is the purchases I made here also translated to the PC version

The music making is cool and it has a great layout for beginners. But that doesn't mean that I don't have a complaint. Attempting to import an ".mmjproject" that's been shared with me always gives me an error. At first I thought this was because I didn't have a mix pack(s) that the one that shared the file with me had added, but then I go ahead and get the same mix packs as them, attempt to import it again and it still comes up with the same I suggest collaborating via call until it's fixed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are encountering an issue with the app. We‚Äôd be happy to help resolve the issue, simply email us at support@loudly.com with a detailed description of how it occurred, and then we can assist further. Thanks!
Your MMJ team

scraped_reviews.content: Artist Trap. I've had a 5 star review here for a while, but the problem becomes apparent once you want to actively do something with this music. Because they intentionally make licensing obtuse (they won't even explain it in comments, they'd rather control the narrative by emailing in private) you end up having to spend double or even triple what you pay on packs. For some reason licensing isn't included when you purchase a mix pack, so you don't own anything and you can't use it for anything.

Had a lot of fun putting tracks together even with the limited keys you can play in. Recorded a few songs and took a short break from it. Now half of my "free" mix packs have been taken away and I have to pay for them if I want to hear anything I created. Licensing issues? Extortion? While it's still fun to mess around with don't invest any major time or effort you may end up quite disappointed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Em Kaen,

Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are encountering an issue with mix packs. Simply email us at support@loudly.com and we‚Äôd be happy to help you resolve the issue.

Your MMJ team

scraped_reviews.content: So, it's about... I don't know how long now, but I've pretty much gotten back up and running with the app going on to create so many tracks with the rock and metal packs. But there's one problem I've noticed that's gotten quite frequently, and that's the packs when I'm using them in a song sometimes corrupt and, although it can be fixed rather easily by simply reactivating it, it forces me to save my project, reactivate the pack, then go back in to continue JAMming. Can you fix this glitch?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we would like to fix this. As we don't have your email address, can you please write us at support@justaddmusic.net so that we can assist you better. We look forward to your email.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is VERY easy to use! It's hard to find a good music maker for mobile devices. Someone can be bad at making music and still sound good. I do have one problem with this app though. It sometimes gets corrupted by clearing the cache, and one time, a fatal error occoured. It couldn't load the engine. No worries, a quick reinstall will do the trick!

Update 2022: I still use this app weekly and have made countless albums of music off of this app! I can say hands down its one of the best music creation apps I've ever used!! Absolutely love the variety of music packs on there and the amount of customization you can do! The community feature is really cool too! My only con I have is that I wish the android version could port all of the packs you own to the Windows version, so you don't have to buy on separate platforms for packs and can use both programs with the many amounts of choices. 2016: I posted a previous review about a negative crashing error a week ago. That review was not accurate. I have been using this software for about 4 months now. And I really like it on Android but LOVE it on Windows. I have made probably about 3 albums worth of music from this software and there are so many expansion packs to choose from. I will continue to keep using this software for as long as Android and windows are a thing!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Ray,

Thank you for your feedback! Please contact musicmakerjam.android@magix.net for your technical issue and describe your technical issue with all details, so we can fix it.

Thanks,
Your JAM Team

scraped_reviews.content: A good way to get started in the field of musis if your just looking to play around, but the app has issues. For one, it's too slow. I updated my phone and the app and it still takes a while to load me in or upload my music. SECOND, I won't even let me save MY MUSIC, that I worked hard on making, to my phone. I try to save a track that I already uploaded to Google drive, but it save a document of numbers instead! NO AUDIO! I'm done with this app. I've grown out of it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: To assist with this issue, it would be helpful to have a little bit more information. Can you send any screenshots related to the issue along with your device details at support@justaddmusic.net? Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: It doesn't really work. It used to be a cool music app when it worked, now it wouldn't let me log in for the longest of time. I have a new phone now and it finally let me log in, but when I started making music the plays the music but the image is like frozen. then later after I get a good beat going it goes all white and lost all my progress. I also had to uninstall it to see if it worked but it didn't. sometimes the app doesn't even load and won't show the loading numbers.

Please fix the filter editing. Whenever I want to add a filter at the beginning of the beat, it autoplays and won't let me start the filter effect from the start. It's frustrating. That and some sounds don't actually stop when they are turned off in the next section.. it bleeds over, and makes a brief, unpleasanty ubrupt sound. It's especially noticeable when I am slowing things down in songs and it just throws off the whole rhythm and attention.

I wish that I could get a refund for all the time and money I put into this app. Don't get me wrong, it's handy for basic beats, but nothing compares to simply investing in a version of Fruity Loops or etc. This app can easily lure you into buying sound packs because there will always be "something" missing from that groovy tune you've created. If you're new to music making, then this app is perfect. But if you're really serious about it, invest in yourself with something more worth while.‚úåÔ∏è
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, thank you for your feedback! Please contact support@justaddmusic.net if this issue still persists. We will surely be able to help you!

Your JAM team

scraped_reviews.content: I love the app and have spent way more time and money on it than I ever expected. My only complaint is that besides the decent selection of free samples, there doesn't seem to be any way of earning credits to purchase new samples. Paying money is the only option I found besides what you earn for playing the tutorial. Also, the app crashes randomly and you will loose any unsaved progress so I'd recommend saving often.

Ads for beat coins? The action thing gets annoying sometimes and doesn't always work, and considering that is the only way to get them after the first 180 (as far as I know) getting them gets nearly impossible due to the current way to get them free being buggy sometimes. Edit: also a notification setting for when someone puts out a new song would be nice as well, as sometimes inspiration is nice, and you won't know what is and isn't new.

After a few years ive decicded to change my review. This app is 100% the best music making app there is tons of loops, fx's and limitless possibilities. The premium subscription is cheap and worth it. I probably spent too much getting new packs but in the end i can make songs and beats exactly how i wamt to. And as a big plus it inspires people, not just me, to try and make their own music 10/10 i would recomend this to anyone, not just people who want to make music, but everyone.

I love the app, but have a couple ongoing issues. 5-7 tracks I cant edit because it says I no longer have these packs, like 2 were free, but there were a few that I had paid for, and another issue is sometimes some of my volumes will get put back in the original mid setting at random. Third, the ad in the app says beatcoins are now doubled but the last 2 times mine weren't doubled. And a suggestion: to be able to add imported audio clips instead of just recording, for better audio quality.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi T F, Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are encountering issues. Simply email us at support@loudly.com and we‚Äôd be happy to help you resolve the issue. Your MMJ team

scraped_reviews.content: It use to be a good platform to make music when they weren't charging you for everything aside from the few lame freebies. Unfortunately, like every other good thing that starts out ends up getting greedy once they see how popular their product becomes. Also, your downloads disappear at the top when trying to create a song. You click to "show all" and half of them don't even show up which forces you to close the app and reload your song to find your missing downloads.

I love the app the feel of it is what I like most it's different from most others easier to understand right off rip but still very limited as to what options there to making the music some other ways then just loops would be nice . Here's the thing. I would give this a 5/5 IF IT DIDNT CRASH HALFWAY through a song I'm creating and delete not only all of my work but the save file with it. It happens everytime so I have to make a save then try to back the save up and thencontinueIt is frustrating
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are encountering an issue with the app. We‚Äôd be happy to help resolve the issue, simply email us at support@loudly.com with a detailed description of how it occurred, and then we can assist further. Thanks!
Your MMJ team

scraped_reviews.content: If you think this is one of the stereo typical "DJ apps" well you're wrong there buddy, they have multiple free selections of different genres of music to choose from along with cheap in app purchases. My favorite part about it is that you can make music offline and save it for when you get WiFi. One other cool thing is that you can share your creations and download other user creations on the app, it's like an Instagram for music.

It looks and feels really good. Unfortunately, the options on how you mix things is really limited. I want fade in/out preferably with different functions to control the level of fade. I would really love the ability to have mixins off set from each other, so I can have some that just repeat in the background, and not restart when I have others that need to be on a shorter section.

I think this app is well-made however this app is only appeals to a novice music creator that is willing to settle for limitations and just casual creation of music I have two glaring issues that prevent me from fully endorsing this application. [First] I downloaded this app thinking I could make music and then access the music that I just made. However there are extreme limitations on the access you have to the music that you made due to the packs that you use. I was frustrated when I went to download the music and access the music for my personal files, that is when I found out that I was not able to do that. You see each music pack seems to have different rights and privileges for the user, whether or not they can or cannot access the music outside of the app or outside of the app's music community which was a big disappointment. [Second] your creativity is capped you are only allowed to use samples of created music you're not allowed to design or setup your own music, beats or instruments patterns. That too was a disappointment. aside from those issues the app has brought me some level of entertainment although it didn't last very long.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your honest feedback! We are always working to improve your experience as much as possible. Stay Tuned! Your JAM team

scraped_reviews.content: It's awesome app! Made some pretty cool songs on it. Just wish I could go more in depth. The app makes it so easy to make a song! Which, is great, but I wish I could go more in depth with editing like the sound waves and when and where to start stop certain loops. I think the only reason I cant is to make it as easy as possible to create music. And I wish there was a voice change option or auto tune for ppl like me that cant sing to save my life! Overall GREAT app!

I like the app, feel like I'm able to control the music I make compared to a previous "high rated" app I had. My only problems or rather my lack of understanding is why mix packs suddenly become corrupted when you attempt to make a track with multiple mix packs. In addition when doing a live recording, it's hit or miss. Sometimes it will record and other times there's just a red button that isn't doing anything.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are encountering an issue with the app. We‚Äôd be happy to help resolve the issue, simply email us at support@loudly.com with a detailed description of how it occurred, and then we can assist further. Thanks!
Your MMJ team

scraped_reviews.content: I definitely think that the user interface could be a little bit more user-friendly seems like some things are a little convoluted when trying to do simple things. Also having trouble using the app on my phone and my tablet trying to sign in and it's saying that the login is invalid. Still having trouble logging in. No one gets back to me. Email for password reset is not sent immediately or ever. Horrible horrible experience lately. The app was fine until a few weeks ago. What the heck happened?! Very frustrated.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Travis, thank you for your feedback! We are always working to improve your experience as much as possible. Your JAM team

scraped_reviews.content: I love the Hands-On tutorial how it teaches you and lets you create a song at the same time. So many of the other apps that I downloaded I'm still trying to figure out. Which probably means I will be deleting them. This one has so many features but is not oversaturated. It has a good variety of instruments. Many of the other apps only have electronic sounding instruments. With this app, you can make any different drummer of music you want to. I like the voice recording feature as well

I've been using this for years + it's the only app I'll spend money on. I don't know technicalities in music, but rather lyricism + play by ear. So I love the ease of navigation. I was able to make a couple tunes from the freebies, so I could justify the few dollars for the rather large mixpacks yu get. However, it's the only app I can't record vocals via phone mic, while the track plays through earbuds. Used to work; nothing else new since. I've tried basically everything.

Good for what it is. I'm a "real" musician, so for me to enjoy making music I need more control than what this app gives me. There's no actual "writing" involving. You just pick loops and put them together. This is NOT a music writing app, it's basically for non-musicians to goof around. My only real complaint is that there's no automation; you either let a loop play all the way through or not at all. (Great loops, but no automation makes them difficult.) Good, but not a serious music app.

It was great at first but I lost my original account and I had 8 songs on it. The app needs to have an account saver on it. Another major problem is that you can't modify single instruments to make different sounds. The notes change for every instrument rather than for specific instruments that you would like to change them for. If I had the choice I would change the notes for the piano and the guitar only. They should also add chillhop type beats and instruments in the store.

There are better, there are worse, but I've been having fun with this app since they released it to monthly subscription may or may not be worth the extra features. But it is nice to have them and they are not too expensive. Be warned you cannot transfer your songs the way you can transfer your sound packs so figure out how to export them before you change devices!

This is a good app for beginning musicians to start making some sweet tracks. Sure, it doesn't let you take instruments and sequence their every note, but it ain't losing stars for that - this app lets you mix and match a wide variety of different tracks and tunes to make your own good sound, and with so many options, every song is unique! Highly recommended!

Great for making songs. Wish that there were more options to edit layers with fade in and out and also balance sound with each individual loop, etc. Not much in the ability to choose options for fine tuning. Also, could use more royalty free loops if we can't post publicly . We need to be able to create our own and with entire note scale. Love this app, real cool to learn with and have fun

Uhh been great tbh. Been using it for over a year and it's always fun. The sounds have gotten better. I'd give it 6 out of 5 if it had a few more things but I shouldn't be picky. Great fun and I've seen them upgrade a lot. Thank.you for the app. *edited* idky some people are having problems with the app. I've gone through 3 phones and half my my packs. The interfaces work and load fast for me. The only sad part is after about a year and a half they started to charge per month. I don't mind tho

Love love love this app. Definitely one of the best in my book. My only issue is that the software doesn't link on my laptop or iPad right away. I'm not a DJ, and have never played an instrument. More the lyricist and even I have created some very rocking beats. Also, it takes a while for the mix packs to load quickly on the phone. Even with wifi connected. Other than that, Outstanding app.

This is really fun to use and easy to learn. My only 2 problems are the fact that it comes with 2 free starting music choices out of 4 options. And while that may not bother some, it bothers me because on PC I had 1 starter and 3 additional free choices out if many, many options. The starting options are very limited. Up next is saving it too my phone, which might just be a me problem.

While the music is generally easy to control and keep going, and you can probably create some nice creations, i would warn people of a few issues. For one, it is much too hard to gain the coin currency and the rewards for the tutorials did not work for me. Second, i have had my recordings and progress wiped before. Honestly i would not recommend this app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Krystal,

Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear about your issue with the tutorial rewards and recordings. We would be very happy to help you solve these issues. simply email us at support@justaddmusic.net and we'll help you further.

Your JAM Team

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, surprisingly good sample quality, easy controls.. awesome for mixing samples and making cool music. You can export your finished tracks and add them to your playlist to keep even if you delete the app (as long as you use "royalty free" samples or import your own samples to use, which you can do!) I totally recommend this app to anyone new to DJing or simply interested in making music through the mixing/layering of samples. Tons of sample packs to choose from to create hours and hours of awesome music! I totally love it!

I'm completely impressed with the idea behind this app, however if you're looking for a music writer app or a DAW like app there's far better apps that are free, that can be found with a little internet research. If you want to make a bunch of songs based around loops, there's better apps for that as well, but good effort. I enjoyed it, but not my cup of poo poo soup.

Some tech glitches here and there, but it is extremely user friendly for composing and editing the music. Have many great music packs to choose from and even throws in free mix packs and contests. After recording and releasing the track, you can upload it to youtube, facebook, twitter, and are connected with Loudly..a social music app strictly for music making jammers out there.

Super user friendly, and fun from the start. I've never paid for a single style, and still enjoyed making music for a couple months now. And the community is really great. Highly doubt there is a better music making app, and I've used several. 11/18/2020 (years later) Still using the app, and it's even better now. Paying for the pro version is worth it, because it really adds a lot to what is possible to be produced. And from what others have been releasing, I'm sure they agree.

Very easy to use and has very authentic samples. HUGE variety of mix packs...enough for anyone to create whatever type of sound theyre looking for. The only thing its missing is that you cant edit individual loops. So say if you want to just change the note from a to G to your bass line.... it'll change everything from a to G in that particular part of the track. If it weren't for that...this app will be getting a 5 star rating from me! Enjoy and let your creativity take control!

It's a great app to make music and is very creative I would recommend this app to anyone who is wanting to get started with making music. Also I wish there was more free packs. Not everyone has money for coins or no money at all. If a pack is over 1 to 5 years old it should become free. The newer ones I can understand the charge of money or coins for. Just an idea.

I've been using this app for years. While it has great potential, it lacks severely. I've lost so much work due to glitches with their app on countless occasions. From simply updating, I've lost complete entire projects that vanish from my files. To exports never working. Trying to copy data from an old phone to a new phone, I've lost practically all my old projects. From purchasing not being transferable. Now, aside from all the problems it can be great. But you have to walk on thin ice.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you encountered issues with the app. If the issues still persist, we would be happy to help resolve them and give more explanation. Simply email us at support@loudly.com with a detailed description of how it occurred, and then we can assist further. Thanks! Your MMJ team

scraped_reviews.content: I have been using this awesome music loop app for approximately 6 years. I can't find anything wrong with it, except I am addicted to creating music I like to hear. I hope it let's everyone else have as much fun as I have had. I recommend downloading loudly for playing the music in other formats and to allow others to play your music on their devices within loudly. Why are there 3 questions below this text box that don't allow yes as an option..yet, yes would clearly be a possibility!?

Love this app, but I wish they had more effects for recording vocals in the program, or had some way that you could import vocal files into projects. Maybe a few more channels and effects in the pro version as well, but other than that, I have spent countless hours on this app. The memories I have with my buddy Dave, making songs together in his car getting super baked are absolutely priceless. Thanks for all great times üòä

I love this app but I've had a couple issues with it. First issue is sometimes it freezes and then force closes shortly after which is very inconvenient being that it happens randomly and doesn't care whether you have saved the progress you've made on your songs. Second issue is that I've completed several of the tasks available to get free beatcoins (one of which cost me real money) and have not recieved the beatcoins as promised. This is very annoying. If fixed, I will change my rating. Thanks

title: Sweatcoin„ÉªWalking Step Counter
description:
Step up your fitness game with Sweatcoin!

Looking for a fun way to boost your fitness & get rewarded? Sweatcoin, the viral walking app is here to transform your steps into real-world rewards! Earn Sweatcoins with every step you take and redeem them for exclusive gadgets, sports gear, and amazing experiences in our marketplace! You can even donate your sweatcoin to good cause and make a difference.

The more you walk, the more earn! And the more you earn, the more you walk! 


Discover the benefits:

- Effortless step tracking: Sweatcoin‚Äôs pedometer runs smoothly in the background, tracking your steps accurately without draining your battery. It‚Äôs your perfect fitness companion, whether you‚Äôre walking, running, or working out at home.

- Unlock rewards: Use your sweatcoins to access incredible offers and discounts that you won‚Äôt find anywhere else. Your fitness journey has never been so rewarding!

- Get moving, get badges: Hit your daily step goals and collect unique badges for each milestone achieved.

- Calling all streak masters: Compete with friends to see who can maintain the longest step streak. Fitness is more fun with a little friendly competition!


Features

Privacy first: We use a secure, proprietary algorithm to count your steps. Your location and personal data stay private‚Äîonly you have access to your information.
Pedometer: Accurate step tracking with minimal battery usage.
Device compatibility: Available on Android and iOS devices. Apple Watch users can also enjoy Sweatcoin. Android Wear compatibility is on the way!

- Calling all streak masters: Compete with friends to see who can maintain the longest step streak. Fitness is more fun with a little friendly competition!

summary: Pedometer that gives you sweatcoins for steps. It pays to walk!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is the biggest rip off for the 'premium' version. I walk a lot (400k+ steps per month avg), so I tried the premium trial. I forgot all about it, so I've been charged $21 for the past 3 months. So, I figured I should have a good amount of coins saved up, log onto the app, and I've got a whooping 50 coins (or what equates to a .10 value)! I would expect much more than that even with the free version considering I walked 1.75 million steps during this time. So, what does paying get you?!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Please contact our support team via support@sweatco.in. We will assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: Latest update is draining my battery like crazy. I was wondering why my battery was going so quickly so I checked my phones settings and found that SweatCoin used 43% over night! Also, there's nothing good to use the coins on. It's all advertising, even the "deals" you can use your coins on. Then when you use those coins (which I only did once) you get targeted ads for the product you just got. It's all hot garbage.

I have enough points for gift cards within my first month, but it says every day that the $5, $10 & $15 are sold out. Nothing to buy. The small amount showing sold does not change. Probably from Years ago. I referred someone, did not get credit I'll update my review if I can ever redeem my points for a card. This app also really drains my battery. They should not advertise rewards for cards if it is not possible to do. The reward gift like Amazon cards should never be sold out. Ridiculous!!!
Another broken app... losing a streak and not getting any notifications is an amazing job. Removing the app from my phone.

This app's concept is great, and it's good motivation to go outside. However, there should be more offers for gift cards like there used to be. Now, the good stuff is 5k+ swc. Also, the app needs to have more consistent tracking of steps. The fact that nearly every single comment complains about this means that it's the app's biggest issue. If you release an update claiming to track indoor steps and verify nearly all, why not just track all of them? Clearly the algorithm doesn't work.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review! Please know that we have rewards ranging from 5 sweatcoins all the way up to our marathon offers, so there's bound to be something that takes your liking! Additionally, if there wasn't, you can also donate your sweatcoins to NGO's across the globe :)

scraped_reviews.content: App used to be really great. It keeps track of your steps and you earn coins, but the rewards just aren't there anymore. I get ads when trying to purchase stuff with coins after paying to not have ads, and the rewards are no longer fun. The app just isn't what it used to be. 5 years ago it was great, I got some stuff and it was fun. Now it's just, 10% off this, a free 7 day trial of this if you've never Used it before, etc. Sad to see the deals dwindling away. Time to find a new step tracker.

The only things to spend your coins on are items that aren't worth even what they want to charge you for shipping, trials of services that you can get anyway without spending coins, or auctions. To get anything from an auction it would take about 10 years for a reasonably active person to win the auction. Plus there is no customer support whatsoever. Then I finally found something that seemed to be worth it, paid for it with the coins and then the code they gave me didn't work. Did I mention that there is no customer support. It's just a waste of time to interact with this app to get the coins.

I really enjoy this app, it's a great concept. The only thing that bugs me a little is when I purchase something for "100% off" with some ridiculously high shipping price listed (which is basically just how much the item will cost with the "100% off discount"). And relative to the price it seems like a good offer at first but that's until you realize you have to pay for shipping on the website as well so it isn't actually a 100% discount. More like a 70% off discount. It's very misleading.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. Please note that while some of our offers are discounts and subscriptions which you're required to pay towards, some offers are totally free too! Just make sure you check back in the marketplace all the time as we constantly add new items! :)

scraped_reviews.content: The GPS tracking is much better than when I last used it. I decided to give it another try because I got an email from them that they had better redemption options. I don't really agree though, because almost all redemptions are only percentages off an order. I also dislike that I get random followers. I can't block them, and I can't turn off an option to allow followers. Unless I know them in person it's creepy.

The app is well made, and easy to use. Easy to warn as long as you want to sweat. My only gripe is how limited the store is. I want to be able to purchase items such as giftcards, subscriptions, and/or redeem my coins for actual cash. The auction idea is a bit of a wash as I don't find it fair that I do my end of the deal for a CHANCE to acquire something actual worthwhile. As a person trying to get back into fitness this tool is fantastic, but underwhelming. Once I can gain from it, easy 5 star
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review here and feedback! We'd love to partner with more companies who will give you real money in the form of gift cards for your steps, but unfortunately, not all companies are aware or believe the value of your steps alone as currency -- yet! We are working on it though and hope to partner with more companies in the future! :D

scraped_reviews.content: I actually have paid for the annual subscriptions for years. What for? Well for the daily reset, you are fighting with legit bots. Not even real people to get the good items. WHICH YOU'LL NEVER WIN. They sell out in less than a fraction of a second, and the amount of stock was left unknown. Noone knows if the items are even real. People who manage to actually buy the items, never recieve anything at all. So if you got this app, thinking you'll be awarded. No, you just gave them your data/money.

The "prizes" are mostly just coupons and promotions. Things like 'get a month free when you subscribe!' and 'get half off your first offer!'. There's almost nothing listed that you're truly not the one paying for it in some way. Really it just seems like a more gimmicky way of getting people to click on ads.

You really need to make the wallet balance transferable to a PayPal account or a bank. It's not fair to users to not have options. If it truly pays to walk. Obviously, there should be a set limit that can transfer to a bank. The app is neat except what was mentioned above. Thats the only improvement that would make this app extremely useful and popular. Weak app and users don't benefit from any purchases from it's so called store. The premium features and offers are constantly "sold out". Fail
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review here and feedback! We'd love to partner with more companies like PayPal who will give you more money for your steps, but it can take a while to get everyone on board to believe walking is valuable as a currency.

scraped_reviews.content: The store has very few options and most of them are things like "free month trial of (insert service)". Some of the already limited options on which to use your coins still cost money, they are just 50% off coupons that are hard to get to work in my experience. The best products are for premium members only and the pretty good products are out of stock so quickly that I have never actually seen something that I both want and is available at the time.

Pretty great app. All you have to do is walk. Every step goes towards receiving in-app credits you can use to purchase deals they offer. The offers are nice, but limited and a lot of them I'm not into. Also, note I said "deals". A lot of the offers are discounts or a free month's subscription. Also, you can receive only a limited amount of credit a day. You can upgrade your account for a monthly fee (no cash, you pay with your free credits) in order to gain more credits a day.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for your great review and feedback here!
We hope you keep enjoying Sweatcoin! :D

scraped_reviews.content: Liked it, was pretty accurate for me, despite what I was reading in the reviews. But there was no way to put it on standby or to turn it off as it stayed on all of the time and used my memory which I can't tolerate, especially with an older phone. Samsung S5. Primarily, it seemed to interfere with running "Waze" as the app would lock up. Uninstalled it and Waze runs fine.

So disappointed, absolutely loved this app until the last update, the app now refuses to track more than half of my steps, let alone convert them. I have contacted via in-app support, email, etc. and still nothing. I'll change my review when the issue is resolved, but I've done my part and nothing has changed so far. Edit- I have uninstalled and redownload 4 times now, I have followed the instructions on the tab to a T. It doesn't matter, it will not enable verification no matter what I do.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry for this. We‚Äôd suggest making sure you've installed the latest version of Sweatcoin and go to the main page of the app and clicking the "i" button. From here, please click "enable" in the yellow card and follow the instructions to ensure your device isn't adding battery saving restrictions to Sweatcoin which could be causing issues.

scraped_reviews.content: I would give 5 stars if there was an option to fully purchase products/services with coins. I have 1500 in coins, but there's nothing to buy (other than coupons, free trials, etc.). There's the occasional auction, but it's over by the time I get to it. I will change my rating once the shop becomes more varied, along with the ability to actually purchase things. And no, I'm not going to download another app just to earn crypto ü§£. Make this one decent first.

It's ok but none of the stuff you can get are even worth it. Do all that work for pretty much nothing. Wish it could be used like cash! It's kind of a waste when you still have to lay cash for shipping and what you can get isn't really worth all the work! I can no longer clame the daily offers. My screen times out waiting for it to load then it jumps to the top of the page.

Cool in theory, but most the stuff you can "buy" you can already get for the same price just by googling. Example, you don't need to spend any sweatcoins to get the $3 Harry's razors deal. It is available to anyone. The real items will take you years to save up for even walking miles every day. For me this is not worth the impact it has on my data usage and battery life.

I downloaded this app a few months ago, and it had no problem using my GPS signal to track my approximate location and calculate steps that way. not very accurate, but hey, I was making steps and adding them up. now all of a sudden it says my device doesn't have a built in pedometer and it wants to connect to my Google fit! I dont have a Google fit! I'm not that obsessed with fitness, I just love walking! uninstalled and I dont intend to reinstall it.

okay app so far. Will keep updating as time goes by. Rewards are mediocre, like discounts on stuff I can find on other apps or sites. Definitely underwhelmed. you can get a dyson hair dryer for 20000 points which is insane as I've been earning about 10 points everyday. It runs in the background. Wish you could sync to fitbit. haven't found a way to use the PayPal cash out. Maybe it only appears after a certain amount of time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review. We are currently undergoing a few internal tests and trials as we work to revamp our marketplace! Your comments are incredibly valuable to us and please trust that we are taking them on board - don't fret, as we have some exciting ideas on the horizon, so I'm sure they'll be something perfect coming your way soon!

scraped_reviews.content: Sophisticated pedometer with coupons.Okay so don't think of this like money there aren't a lot of offers. Positives: I know that the steps it counts are the steps I take. I like having the tracker like that. I like the competitive features of it too. Negatives: I wish less of them required card details and cancelling subscriptions. I would prefer like just a coupon code for a single item. The store is small but they are getting off the ground and I wish there was a greater range of products to pick from. Overall worth a download just watch your battery and don't think you'll be a millionare.

Don't plan on getting the rewards. You can rack up credits easily, but the rewards are just a list of ads. The gift cards advertised are never available and always sold out. I have checked in at various and multiple times daily and NEVER have gotten a chance to get a gift card. They have a very limited number, like 25 for each type. Now, if you would like a one-stop shop for "deals" on things you can get anywhere, this is the app for you!

It was working great the first week. It stopped counting steps. I've did the whole configuration thing to make it more accurate. Nothing is making it work. I'm about to delete it cause it's also running my battery down and I gotta charge it more than usual. If the problem can be fixed, I might consider 5 stars and a new review. Until then, stars will drop off. I emailed sweatcoins just to be told to contact support. Sweatcoins sucks. I don't recommend it any longer.

I've been using this for almost a year. It requires an update everytime you open it, which is annoying. And I just realized it hasn't credited any of my steps for over a month now. Hard for me to delete, since it is a free app and maybe they'll improve it. But also, I haven't seen anything worth spending coin on since i started using it. The offers still require shipping or subscriptions, and many are just discounts you can find online already. I haven't gotten any value out this app.

Rewards: Sold Out... I've had this app on my phone for a few years now and I will say, the concept is great... But, rewards and redemption are not great. It went from not having good rewards in the store to having them but never being able to claim them. I think that the rewards update in the store super early in the morning, but by the time you open the app to claim they're gone. So, it's great that they've started adding better rewards, but they aren't attainable.

The advertisements for this app are misleading. You don't get paid by walking - you earn points when you walk. Those points are redeemable towards daily changing items with companies that they are partnered with. Most of the items require you to put in credit card information because you have to pay for shipping, etc. The more exciting items require you to have tens of thousands of points in order for you to redeem them. I kept the app just in case items show up that I like in my points range.

I reviewed this about a year ago and nothing has changed. I've been using this app since 2018 and there's never been anything useful in the shop. Just coupons you can get elsewhere and "offers" you have to spend money to get. There are gift cards, but only on auction for way more than they're worth. This app is a waste of time and space on your phone, all so they can make money off of your ad revenue & data without giving anything of value back. I'm over it, finally uninstalling. Good riddance.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback here and will pass this along to our wider team for future improvements!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is not as advertised. Yes, it counts steps. Yes, it gives you "reward" options. But if you're not interested in paying $5 a month or $25 a year for "premium" you get little to nothing. I have thousands of their coins with nothing to spend then on unless I want to get a percentage off an item I'd never use or a discounted subscription to something. The better items are ALWAYS out of stock and the app never notified when the shop gets new items. Save yourself time, don't use this.

I used to really love this app. The items that you could 'purchase' with the sweatcoins earned were varied and there was a good number of them. Including physical products that you could pay for completely with the sweatcoins. Recently though, there are very few things to choose from and most just give a discount thats not even worth it. Same with any digital offers. It's disappointing because I loved it for a long time.

This app has great potential. However, there are still a lot of quirks that need to be worked out. Step count is not accurate, and I can watch my steps when using the app, leave the app, and come back in to find missing steps. I even took screenshots while doing a workout. It registered over 3,500 steps, then dropped to just over 1,200. Also, when I click to try and get to the start of the 20 min challenge, most of the time, it does nothing.

I've had this app for 4 years, and it definitely was much better ~2-3 years ago. There used to be a lot more offers for physical items or discounts for physical items; now, the majority of the rewards are temporary discounts on subscription services. It makes it really underwhelming to check the shop every now and then and see no new variety in the offers, even if they don't cost many coins. They give out a very limited amount of gift cards too, so they're easy to miss.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Thanks for your review. Unfortunately, we have limited stock. We are working hard to partner with other companies who value your steps as much as we do, but we hope you understand this can be tricky! However, we are adding new offers all the time, so keep an eye out!

scraped_reviews.content: I've had this app for yrs now. The notifications are on, but it doesn't appear in my drop down menu anymore. Both of my other walking for rewards apps do still. As a result, I often forget about this one. I recently got a Fitbit watch & am trying to connect it w\ these type apps. Haven't played with that on this one though as it's always hidden! Also, the other 2 apps allow you to "purchase" gift cards to stores like Walmart, Taco Bell, etc. This app just has discounts for things to buy really.

Pretty disappointed. Thought that there would be good rewards and things to cash out for but there is not. Half of them are subscription boxes that want you to keep paying after. It's just small junk items that say "sold out" when they've barely been on there. There is a paypal cashout but not until you hit 20000 points (which would take years because you can only earn a certain amount of points a day). I've had it for months and have not been able to cash out for anything. Dumb.

This app is just another advertising platform. It tricks you into thinking you are actually earning some type of financial reward but all they offer are coupons to products you don't want and after a few weeks or months, they reduce your step count to almost nothing so you get discouraged and delete the app. Don't download it. It's a waste of memory space on your phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry about this! Since our last update we've seen a few users with step conversion problems - but not to worry! Our dev team are working on releasing a fix really soon, and you'll start to see more sweatcoins per day than ever! Please bear with us!

scraped_reviews.content: 06/1/21 Decent app, the items for sale usually were not to my interest, and you still have to pay for shipping. There should be an option to pay extra sweatcoins to cover shipping. I'd way rather that than have to spend my own money, it kind of defeats the purpose 10/04/23 It should be nothing but physical products paid in full. Thats how it used to be and it needs to return to that. No discounts, no free trials, no sweepstakes, and especially no mixed in advertising disguised as if theyre deals
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. Please note that while some of our offers are discounts and subscriptions which you're required to pay towards, some offers are totally free too! Just make sure you check back in the marketplace all the time as we constantly add new items! :)

scraped_reviews.content: The app could be better. Linking health apps like Google Fit and Samsung Health should be easier for current steps counted. In addition, it does not sync the whole month with those apps. it would be nice if it synced with those apps when they are opened. In addition, the steps from my watch are not counted until the next day. Which voids any boost opportunities. There is so much potential for a great app. Please keep working on this.

Had this for over half a year and hundreds of coins. Yet I have checked throughout the months, and every single gift card is ALWAYS sold out. The only thing to spend the coins on really is the discounts on stuff. I really don't even believe that there really is a gift card option as at times I have checked multiple times a day, and they are always sold out. Disappointing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Please understand that there is only one type of offers which sell out quickly, and these are the self funded offers which are paid for by Sweatcoin ourselves and why they're in limited supply.
We have heaps of other offers in our marketplace and we'd encourage you to also check these out! These are partnerships with other brands and change daily!

scraped_reviews.content: I have used this app for years, and though the marketplace has gone downhill, it's still a fun way to track steps. Unfortunately, much as I don't want to, I'm forced to uninstall. Suddenly the battery usage is out of control. When I started needed to charge my phone multiple times a day, I found that this app, which I don't even open most days, is by far the highest battery usage on my phone, far above and beyond even my most actively used apps. Looking through other reviews, it's not uncommon.

I would give this app a 5, but there a few issues I have. The first being it tracks my steps different than my phone does. It's always off by a few hundred. The second is that we only have very few options on what we can spend our sweat coins on. The third and final issue I have that I would like to see resolved for everyone is being able to transfer our money to our bank accounts or have a check cut for the amount that we have. I feel like my "money" is being wasted when that can cover bills.

After having this app for over 1 year, I can say that it is definitely not worth it! Each several thousand steps a day is only worth cents, sadly. A lot of offers they present in the app are just another way of getting you to spend money from other businesses. I remember they would offer disney tickets, new iPhone, and trip to Europe for a vast amount of sweatcoins‚ÄîI don't know if anyone was able to claim within a year because it seems impossible.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review. We are currently undergoing a few internal tests and trials as we work to revamp our marketplace! Your comments are incredibly valuable to us and please trust that we are taking them on board - don't fret, as we have some exciting ideas on the horizon, so I'm sure they'll be something perfect coming your way soon!

scraped_reviews.content: I'm going to be pretty frank, here. Its a pretty okay app if you're looking for a "earn coins for free trials of things" element to your walks but that's it. Some of the bigger things they offer is constantly snatched up immediately by bot accounts that I feel will never be resolved. If you want something a lot more interesting and rewarding, look for Pikmin Bloom instead.

Years ago I used this app and loved it. Back then you were able to use your coins to get actual gift cards to places (like Amazon, Walmart etc) and it added up fast. well I got this app again and now you can only really use it to get discounts on items that they promote. If I'm not in the market for a drone or wireless ear buds, there's no point. There's never anything I want to spend any money on. I will just donate the coins I have to one of their fundraisers and uninstall.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We'd love to partner with more companies like PayPal who will give you more money for your steps, but it can take a while to get everyone on board to believe walking is valuable as a currency. Remember, our main focus is to make the world more active by rewarding you in all different ways for your movement! :)

scraped_reviews.content: There are updates every single day which gets a bit old. As other reviews say, the shop sells out instantly (I haven't seen anything in months that is actually in stock other than offers for "50% off a trial for ---"). The rewards honestly aren't worth it when you can never redeem them. The app just ends up taking up space on my screen.

I haven't been able to claim my Daily Bonus in months. Spent 4.99 toward a "wallet" in an app and it never registered. And now my over 5,000 steps I've logged today suddenly dropped to a big fat zero. Navigation in the app is decent, at least. It would be really nice to be able to link it to other fitness apps or another activity tracker, but that's not a huge negative (for me, at least)

It's well put together known about the app for many years. And I just got to 10 sweatcoins, tried to get the headphones for a discount because they were on sale. Wasn't able to buy them because didn't know I'd have to pay for them, I do understand you can't just give away free stuff but it's kinda bs that I lost all my money in the app and I wasn't even able to get anything üëéüèª
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry for any confusion! Please know that we have a variety of offers -- some are discount offers, some are subscriptions, and some are totally free! Just make sure to read the descriptions carefully before purchasing :)

scraped_reviews.content: Had this app for over a week. Day 1 I was able to play games to earn rewards, then the next day the rewards were gone and I was playing other apps for no reason, thinking I would get rewards. Items redeemable are always "sold out" and you will never be able to spend your coins unless you want 10% off something you could probably get for free through other apps. Lastly, I used the 2x boost and walked around work for 20 minutes, come to find out, none of the steps were counted during the boost.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. We really appreciate the feedback. Unfortunately, we have limited stock. We are working hard to partner with other companies who value your steps as much as we do, but we hope you understand this can be tricky! However, we are adding new offers all the time, so keep an eye out!

scraped_reviews.content: At an average of 10000 steps a day it will take about 2.7 years to buy the cheapest of the only 5 tangible items available in the app store. Other than that the only other things "for purchase" seem to be coupons that are pretty average deals that can be found on plenty of websites. Ultimately they offer absolutely no compensation for being allowed to track your phones every movement.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! Though we would love to give you the world for your steps, it does take the world one step at a time to agree with our view. Offers become better with every month and every day as more companies realise your movement is truly valuable. Our offers change on a daily basis, and you can also donate your sweatcoins to charity!

scraped_reviews.content: The idea of this app is great but it's not being executed correctly. For one, it is not accurate. I have a Fitbit and sweatcoing didn't count most of them. I even have the app open while im walking outside and I'm looking at it and its not updating my steps at all. Second, the amount cents you get for the steps is way too low and the prices for the items are ridiculous. Also, why would you charge a monthly subscription for an app that is supposed to pay you?

title: Hulu: Stream TV shows & movies
description:
Stream TV shows, films, and discover the award-winning classics, blockbuster movies and exclusive Originals that set Hulu apart. From dramas like Sh≈çgun to the fancy proposals of The Bachelor, your next obsession is just a click away. 

Already a Hulu subscriber? Enhance your experience with Hulu + Live TV*, featuring the latest in live sports, news, movies and events across your favorite devices. You can keep up with your favorite sports with Hulu + Live TV, including NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, Golf, Formula 1, soccer and more. Seize control of your entertainment with flexible plans: take your pick from Hulu, Hulu (No Ads), or the ultimate Hulu + Live TV. 

*Regional restrictions, blackouts and additional terms apply.

But wait, there's more! Hulu brings you:

‚óè Tailored recommendations for a viewing experience as unique as you are
‚óè Create up to 6 profiles and make sure each member of your household enjoys Hulu their way
‚óè Effortless tracking of your favorite movies, series and new TV shows
‚óè Watch shows and browse episodes on your favorite devices, at home or on the go. 
‚óè Discover and watch shows and films with our premium network add-ons like MAX, Paramount + with SHOWTIME¬Æ, CINEMAX¬Æ, and STARZ¬Æ, each available for an additional monthly subscription fee**
‚óè NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, soccer and more live sports with Hulu + Live TV - don‚Äôt miss a second of exciting sports action 

**Additional terms and restrictions apply.

HULU WITH ADS
Dive into the vast streaming TV library with Hulu (With Ads) and explore today's most-talked-about TV shows like The Kardashians, The Bachelor, The Handmaid's Tale, and Abbott Elementary. Immerse yourself in Hulu's Originals, like the Emmy¬Æ-nominees The Bear and Only Murders in the Building. Animation? We got you covered with Bob‚Äôs Burgers, Futurama, and more. 

HULU (NO ADS)
Opt for Hulu (No Ads) for an uninterrupted, ad-free streaming experience. Plus, enjoy the option to download select titles for offline viewing.

HULU + LIVE TV
Live TV makes it better! Watch live and on-demand content from 95+ channels, including sports and news, all without the hassle of extra cable fees. Access endless entertainment with the entire Hulu streaming library. Don‚Äôt forget all Live TV plans include access to Disney+ and ESPN+.

You‚Äôll be charged as a recurring transaction through your account starting at the end of your free trial, if any (unless you cancel during the free trial). Payment automatically renews unless you cancel your account at least 24 hours before the end of the current subscription month. Manage your subscription, cancel anytime, or turn off auto-renewal by accessing your account. Hulu is available to U.S. customers only.

Subscriber Agreement: https://www.hulu.com/subscriber_agreement

Privacy Policy: https://privacy.thewaltdisneycompany.com/en/current-privacy-policy

Your California Privacy Rights: https://www.hulu.com/ca-privacy-rights

Do Not Sell My Personal Information: https://www.hulu.com/do-not-sell-my-info

This app features third party software which allows you to contribute to measurement statistics (e.g., Nielsen‚Äôs TV Ratings). To learn more about digital measurement products and your choices in regard to them, including opting out, please visit our privacy policy. Please see http://www.nielsen.com/digitalprivacy for more information about Nielsen measurement.

We may work with mobile advertising companies to help deliver online and in-app advertisements tailored to your interests based on your activities on our website and apps and on other, unaffiliated websites and apps. To learn more, visit www.aboutads.info. To opt-out of online interest-based advertising, visit www.aboutads.info/choices. To opt-out of cross-app advertising, download the App Choices app at www.aboutads.info/appchoices. Hulu is committed to complying with the DAA‚Äôs Self-Regulatory Principles for Online Behavioral Advertising and the DAA‚Äôs Application of Self-Regulatory Principles for the Mobile Environment
