summary: Investments & Cash Accounts

scraped_reviews.content: It's decent for what it provides. My 5year Returns are a bit lower than if I had just putting in s&p500 back then. And on top betterment charges 0.25% mgmt fees, so it's a choice for beginners but you do lose out a bit. Found out it's another $75 fee to transfer out my betterment account. Easy to put money in, harder to get it out here.

I love the Betterment App and platform. So easy to use, and it's great for those that want to invest, but don't want to do all the work themselves. Comes with a fee, but returns outweighs it over time. My only gripe with it is that money you put in the Cash Reserve (Savings) takes forever to withdraw. Especially if you're planning on taking out a large amount. It'll take a whole week before you get your money. PayPal savings has similar rates, and withdrawals in half the time Betterment does.

It would be 5 stars for the yield on the savings account, ease of use and access. Unfortunately the bank they use in New York will not connect to pay my credit cards because it has the wrong length routing number or something. Multiple issues with this, and it wasn't a problem with the incorrect number as I have no issues with direct deposit or spending.

I opened an account to make a bond account. I use another app for my stocks and wanted to give Betterment a go. So far the UI is a cluster. Very confusing. Support is absent. I might not be keeping my account open. They have an easy account set up process which would be good for new investors and older people. But once your account is open... Lacking.... And looking at their reviews from the last several years doesn't give me much hope that they care much about their users feedback.

Good app for investing and has one of the highest APY around for savings accounts. Also worth mentioning is the ATM fee reimbursement (which also applies to ATMs overseas). A few things could be better: they don't allow for automatic bill payments from savings account and you can't set up recurring transfers from savings to checking, which means you have to make sure you transfer money into checking before a bill goes through. Those are standard features on competing apps.

App is so confusing. The layout is cluttered and disorganized. Not to mention the difficulty in transferring funds between your checking and Cash Reserve accounts. You can transfer money to the other account by going to either account, and selecting "transfer". You can also go to that account and there's a "deposit" option, which does the same thing. So... 3 ways to do the same task. But only for certain tasks. Otherwise the app is stable and works as designed. The design just needs tweaking.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for providing such valuable feedback. I've passed your message over to our design team for further consideration.

scraped_reviews.content: I recently had my account suspended for suspicious activity. As it turns out, it was because the Yotta account I have, I can't transfer into taxable accounts (only 1 checking account I sync up). So I called customer service explained the situation, and got my account unlocked. Their email system is good too. While they don't give direct advice, they will link a page that has more info on the topic that does have suggestions with certain situations. They make it easy to Set it & forget it too.

I am a big fan of this app. I like that there a very minimal fees and no deposit or withdraw fees. It's very easy to set up a small (or large) reoccurring deposit from each paycheck into multiple accounts and watch them grow with nearly no effort on my part. It is also nice to have some of my money slightly separate from my traditional accounts as i often get tempted to dip into my savings when i didn't stick to my budgeting for the week. Overall, I would recommend Betterment.

I was originally drawn to Betterment's no fee checking and cash-reserve accounts. Unfortunately they've made linking external accounts a pain. The biggest issue is that they won't recognize my other checking account as a "deposit" accounts. The account will display as a checking account and show the amount held, but you can't do anything with it. I can't recommend a banking service that makes it so hard to move money.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing this feedback! We appreciate it when customers take the time to share their thoughts with us. We‚Äôll take this back to our team for consideration.

scraped_reviews.content: Easy to use, easy to understand, easy to link to my other bank. Got the checking account with debit card. It really does reimburse ATM fees. Also, there are NO hidden fees. There are no fees at all for checking and savings. Only reason I'm still using my other bank is for immediate access to cash, but for savings: Betterment. I don't make a lot of money so the option to invest or save small amounts at a time is just nice.

Great app layout from a great brokerage? Sign me up! In all seriousness, this app is made with both form and function in mind. It's very easy to move your money where you need it to go. I'll admit that I've seen higher savings APY at some banks, but not by much and the cash isn't as liquid at those other banks as it is held here. They even reimburse atm fees on the checking account, a feature that would either cost me $25 a month or have 75k just sitting around at my main bank...

I have been stuck on account review for well over a week. The app says it takes 1-2 business days to review, I go online and it says 4-5 days, I even emailed them about it and have received no replies whatsoever. All I have done is try to open my first account with them, nothing more. I was also hoping to make a savings account, but with things as they are, I can't do anything until they finish the review for my checking account with them. More customer service would be great
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, thanks for the feedback! We're sorry to hear you've had a hard time getting in touch with us! We appreciate your patience as we deal with an especially high number of inquiries. But if you reach out to us at https://www.betterment.com/contact we'll be happy to address your question in the order in which it was received.

scraped_reviews.content: The app is clean, easy to use. I'm able to set up an automatic deposit, check my balance, account performance, etc. I had a question a while ago, and ngl i was on hold on the phone for a while until i gave that up and emailed them. To my surprise they were very punctual in replying back and extremely courteous and helpful. So phone isn't the best but customer service was great over email, overall positive experience so far.

Very limited list of external accounts to be synced automatically, manually updating accounts is a pain. Can't project future value of multiple goals together, only each goal individually. Would love to project my future net worth as an individual, not just for each goal. Now, recently, for some reason, the app only shows investment accounts, I can't see the balance of my external cash and credit accounts, forcing me to have to use my computer
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for your feedback. We will use your suggestions for future iteration and improvement. In regards to the display of your connected accounts, our team is aware of the issue, and we should have this resolved by the end of next week.

scraped_reviews.content: The app works well, no complaints in a vacuum. But compared to the desktop site, the app is extremely limited! And does not make it clear what you can only do on the desktop version. It's fine for peeking in on your portfolio and minor adjustments but largely lacking vs the full site. Also, a major general improvement to Betterment would be being able to keep auto adjust on while changing risk settings +/- a few degrees up or down.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing this feedback! We appreciate it when customers take the time to share their thoughts with us. We‚Äôll take this back to our team for consideration.

scraped_reviews.content: -There's not a way to add an external account on the app, I have to go to the website in a browser to add one on but it would be way more convenient to have that option in the app. -You also can't update your account login in the app if your previous login is out of date, you'll have to that on the desktop website too. -The General Investing page doesn't list the accounts associated with it, you can see it on the browser but you can only see the count of them on the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing this feedback! We appreciate it when customers take the time to share their thoughts with us. We‚Äôll take this back to our team for consideration.

scraped_reviews.content: Something fishy is going on with this app. A lot of people have been getting suspended for no reason or if there is a reason they're not giving you a reason. You'll just be hit up with the email saying your account has been suspended. Also a side note. If you want to get in contact with these people well good luck. Their customer services are always busy and rather than placing you a Q time. The automatic machine just says just "email us" after hanging up. 50% chance getting answerd by email.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, thanks for reaching out. If you reach out to us directly at https://www.betterment.com/contact our team would be happy to manually review your account if you believe it was flagged in error. Thanks for your patience as we experience an especially high volume of inquiries.

scraped_reviews.content: My bank rejected a transfer to Betterment on a Monday, and I was not notified by Betterment until the next day. The only notification I got was that I needed to call in to verify details. Betterment did not tell me that they had unlinked the funding account and now that I have it reconnected, I have to wait "a couple" of days before trying again. Between my bank and Betterment they have managed to turn a 5 minute transaction into a week-long issue.

They do everything they can to try to prevent giving the %5.50 bonus. They are hoping you don't notice. It's suppose to be automatic when you sign up and deposit and funds settle after 3 days, but it just "mistakenly doesn't happen." Then you have to escalate to support to get the deal and even then their response time is delayed by 3 days or longer. Do not trust betterment and shady practices.

It's way too much trouble to deposit and withdraw your own money. I was locked out of my account for an error they made then asked to provide context as to why I wanted to withdraw MY money. Ridiculous! They also lock you out of your account for the slightest thing including making more than 1 deposit from accounts already linked to them. The time, energy, and phone calls in the 1 week I banked with them was absurd.

I give it 4.5 stars. I really like how intuitive and easy it is to use the app. There are many notes that explain everything! You can see deposits, withdrawals, total gain/loss, net gain/loss, total percentage gain/loss, annualized percentage gain/loss, tax documents, etc. I almost always gain and the automatic management fees are a very low percentage (probably about 1%). My only problem is that it is hard to find where to change the investment percentage stocks and percentage bonds.

VERY leary about the idea of investing with Betterment after my initial experience. I deposited $100 into savings, then went to move it into checking, and, poof! Money's gone. I called customer service about 5 business days in and was told first deposits can have a 6 day hold. It has been FOURTEEN FULL business days(excluding all holidays) and my money has not shown up. No doubt, customer service will get my money into my account, but it seems Betterment can't handle even a hundred dollars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jessica! Thanks for your feedback. A member of our customer service team is working on this issue for you. Please feel free to reach out if there's anything else we can do for you!

scraped_reviews.content: UI is great. support isn't so great. I recommend you read the fine print on what they do with your money and what you are responsible for. Some of the elections you make are only changed via support. Example what Banks you perfer in the banking program which is used by the hight yield savings account. Not really my favorite thing to be responsible of my account even though I don't know which banks it's in, and I can only say please don't put in x,y, or z bank. I wish that was more transparent

This app is simple to use for beginners. I was expecting it to be much more difficult but the information on portfolios were easy to find & understand, thus making my choice quickly. Very efficient. My only suggestion would be, making the app have access to financial data in cryptocurrency via exchanges (like Coinbase, for instance) and having real time data access to the balance of any accounts via API KEYS generated on exchanges (again, like Coinbase for instance). Also, no way to cash out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing this feedback, we appreciate it when customers take the time to share their thoughts with us. We'll take this back to our team for consideration.

scraped_reviews.content: Good with one frustrating issue. Once you put a "Target" on an account you can't remove it.* You can change it, but not go back to not having one. It's a small issue but frustrating when I want to use the account a certain way and cannot. Other than that it's a solid, useful app. *This change can be made on their website.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing this feedback, we appreciate it when customers take the time to share their thoughts with us. You are able to update your goal, returning it to No target amount, from a web browser. To do so, log and select your goal then "Plan" then "Edit" (next to "Target"). From here you can leave the target amount blank.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app and experience using it. I wish there were more options for push notifications. I would like to be notified when there is a debit or credit on my checking account. Having few notifications was great when I was just using the app for investing, but checking accounts need more active monitoring and the app is lacking in that area.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for letting us know! We truly appreciate it when customers take the time to provide us with feedback.I‚Äôll pass your feedback on to our team for future development consideration.

scraped_reviews.content: I have used this app for many years and have been very satisfied and never had any problems. Now the app doesn't work and i have no access to my money. Have uninstalled and reinstalled app repeatedly, still doesn't work. It crashes instantly. I have lost all faith in betterment and will be removing all my funds and ceasing use just as soon as I can get access to my money, and the longer that takes, the more livid I will become. Extremely disappointed. App has been fixed now, but I am still wary
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We're happy to let you know that the issue you highlighted should be resolved by updating your Betterment app to version 8.5.1. Please reach out to us at https://www.betterment.com/contact/ if you experience any additional issues.

scraped_reviews.content: I wish Betterment would separate the activity that goes on in each account. I would like to look at my account activity individually. I also would like for them to add the exact amount of my gain/loss under see performance instead of me having to subtract the amount deposited by the value of my account. Overall I like the app. It just seems a bit outdated.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
You can view activity by account on the mobile app. To do so, select the three vertical lines in the top left corner of the app then Activity. From there, click the icon in the top right of the screen to filter by account. 

To see the amount earned, select See performance then press and hold over the performance graph to see the amount earned.

scraped_reviews.content: Easy to use and Easy to understand. I had a problem linking one of my accounts to make a deposit, but after an email, they fixed it and extended their promotion so I could make the deposit and service free for a year. Great and quick customer service. Only thing that would be better is if we could invest in individual stocks too, but the returns it has made in short time during current situation. No problem with me. Definitely recommend to friends

App won't open. I have had a consistent issue with getting the app to open. Whenever I contact customer service about this issue, it takes around 48 hours for a response that tells me to have the latest version of the app installed, which I do. I have contacted customer service multiple times about this and they of no use in solving this issue. It's a shame because Betterment provides a good service.

I signed up with Betterment over a week ago. Despite having other financial accounts, both robo and managed accounts, Betterment still hasn't opened my account. Worse still, I have reached out by email and in the app and have yet to receive a response. Very unprofessional for a financial advisor app. I will be deleting this app as there are equally accessable advisors who want and value my business.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, thanks for the feedback. Sorry for the delay as we've fielded a high number of recent inquiries! I just responded to one of the emails you sent us, so please see that message for some next steps. We appreciate your patience, but please let us know if we can do anything to help in the meantime.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been a Betterment user for over 6 years now. Betterment is simply the best solution for low cost, low maintenance investing. The interface is clean and easy to use in the app. The website allows more detailed analytics when you want it. Documents and help articles are easy to access.

The password said to use 8 characters to enter the account. I used two medium words total 9 letters plus two numbers and a special character and it still won't allow me to use it since the two words are more than 8 characters.

The app has lost functionality in the latest upgrade. I can no longer edit my IRA goal inside the app so I went to the website and cannot do it there either! My investments have done well and I have no complaints about the company itself, but the app, which was formerly great, now kinda sucks.

I vehemently do not recommend using this company. I've had two active accounts for THREE years and they've literally lost every single cent I've ever given them. everyone says "keep waiting" but I've got $6 left. six. dollars. seriously? after three years. the statistics have been nothing but a down slope. dont use it.

I forgot how horrible Betterment was and invested $300, I then tried to get my money out, but mistakenly closed my bank account before getting my money. Now when I log into my account it shows no money in there. Do not invest with Betterment, unless you like losing your money.

I signed up for betterment in 2015 and since then the service has deteriorated year over year. there's no customer service, there's no phone number to contact customer service. on the app, you have to Google the number and it takes them three to five business days to respond to the most simple queries even after you reach customer service.
App is great except Betterment NEEDS Zelle integration!! 2025 and still no Zelle is so frustrating.
For less experienced investors this is a great way to go , very easy to use interface and low fees.

Horrible sign up experience for my daughter. They required photos of her passport, social security card, a selfie, a FULL cell phone bill, and she provided her voter ID card; but it was never enough. My personal experience: they frequently make offers then find a reason why you don't qualify (of course, after you've lived up to your end of the bargain). My daughter went with Public Investing instead. I'm hanging around but they're on a short leash.

this app has made it wildly easy for me to invest and diversify and has redoubled my efforts to dance for my future. I love the variety of accounts it offers as well as the "choose your own adventure" level of involvement for each. I primarily use the "set it and forget it" options and it's REALLY working for me.

i have no idea how this firm has 5 stars. it takes forever to transfer money and then they do not pay interest like all the other banks on pending transactions. i transferred money and they decided to place a hold on it for 14 days!!! for absolutely no reason. with no interest. super annoyed. i will close my account asap. RUN

it's been an easy system to use even for someone like me who has no experience for this stuff. edit: nevermind. this app is for people that already have money. they don't care about the little people trying to make it. makes a decent bank account though. if you like them charging you for losing your money and then tax you for it when you try to take it out.
awesome investing app if you're not too sure how to invest and want an easier way to make your money work for you.
The simplicity of the app is great and I do enjoy the high APR rate that the app gives.

I have been a Betterment user for the better part of 10 years. I was invested in their "aggressive" option for over 10 years and my average annualized return was about 7.3% during the same period of time where the S&P 500 SPY fund averaged 11-12% returns annualized. This cost me tens of thousands in returns so I made a decision to transfer to a different brokerage with more optionality. When I did, I got hit with over $400 in fees. Your money will be better off somewhere else.
easy to use. decent returns with low fees.
Great App! Love the Savings options.

I used betterment but the account lost money immediately. I can understand downturns but starting at a loss and staying there?? The robo investment algorithm needs to be better to put it mildly. I called to speak to customer service but no one could explain any goals or get me in touch with anyone to make adjustments. This was a waste of time and money. I'll stick with Fidelity
The app used to work well, but a recent refresh removed useful information like individual account balances. Yes, it's a financial app that will not show you individual account balances.

title: Snapseed
description:
Snapseed is a complete and professional photo editor developed by Google.



== KEY FEATURES==

‚Ä¢ 29 Tools and Filters, including: Healing, Brush, Structure, HDR, Perspective (see list below)

‚Ä¢ Opens JPG and RAW files

‚Ä¢ Save your personal looks and apply them to new photos later

‚Ä¢ Selective filter brush

‚Ä¢ All styles can be tweaked with fine, precise control



== TOOLS, FILTERS AND FACE ==

‚Ä¢ RAW Develop ‚Äì open and tweak RAW DNG files; save non-destructively or export as JPG

‚Ä¢ Tune image ‚Äì adjust exposure and color automatically or manually with fine, precise control

‚Ä¢ Details ‚Äì magically brings out surface structures in images

‚Ä¢ Crop ‚Äì crop to standard sizes or freely

‚Ä¢ Rotate ‚Äì rotate by 90¬∞, or straighten a skewed horizon

‚Ä¢ Perspective ‚Äì fix skewed lines and perfect the geometry of horizons or buildings

‚Ä¢ White Balance ‚Äì adjust the colors so that the image looks more natural

‚Ä¢ Brush ‚Äì selectively retouch exposure, saturation, brightness or warmth

‚Ä¢ Selective ‚Äì the renown ‚ÄúControl Point‚Äù technology: Position up to 8 points on the image and assign enhancements, the algorithm does the rest magically

‚Ä¢ Healing ‚Äì remove the uninvited neighbor from a group picture

‚Ä¢ Vignette ‚Äì add a soft darkness around the corners like a beautiful, wide-aperture would do

‚Ä¢ Text ‚Äì add both stylized or plain text

‚Ä¢ Curves - have precise control over the brightness levels in your photos

‚Ä¢ Expand -  increase the size of your canvas and fill up the new space in smart ways with content of your image

‚Ä¢ Lens Blur ‚Äì add a beautiful Bokeh to images (background softening), ideal for photographic portraits

‚Ä¢ Glamour Glow ‚Äì add a fine glow to images, great for fashion or portraits

‚Ä¢ Tonal Contrast ‚Äì boost details selectively in the shadows, midtones and highlights

‚Ä¢ HDR Scape ‚Äì bring a stunning look to your images by creating the effect of multiple exposures

‚Ä¢ Drama ‚Äì add a hint of doomsday to your images (6 styles)

‚Ä¢ Grunge ‚Äì an edgy look with strong styles and texture overlays

‚Ä¢ Grainy Film ‚Äì get modern film looks with realistic grain

‚Ä¢ Vintage ‚Äì the style of color film photo from the 50‚Äôs, 60‚Äôs or 70‚Äôs

‚Ä¢ Retrolux ‚Äì go retro with light leaks, scratches, film styles

‚Ä¢ Noir ‚Äì Black and White film looks with realistic grain and the ‚Äúwash‚Äù effect

‚Ä¢ Black & White ‚Äì classic Black and White look straight out of the darkroom

‚Ä¢ Frames ‚Äì add frames with adjustable size

‚Ä¢ Double Exposure - blend two photos, choosing from blend modes that are inspired by shooting on film and by digital image processing

‚Ä¢ Face Enhance ‚Äì add focus to the eyes, add face-specific lighting, or smoothen skin

‚Ä¢ Face Pose - correct the pose of portraits based on three dimensional models

‚Ä¢ 29 Tools and Filters, including: Healing, Brush, Structure, HDR, Perspective (see list below)

summary: Professional quality photo edits with the new Snapseed.

scraped_reviews.content: 3 stars is harsh for a fairly good free photo editing app, but Snapseed has not improved or kept up with the times. It's been the same for the past decade. I would like to see a significant improvement to the healing tool. I would also like to see other editing options offered on other platforms. For example, Canva can edit the background and foreground separately, remove objects, expand the image, etc. Other than that, the tools the app offers are still some of the best out there for free.

I love snap seed! It's a pretty nifty little photo editor. It does a great job and has a wide variety of tools to use as well as a few filters. It works well and is perfect for those who would rather have one smaller sized app with the "must have" tools rather than a ginormus app with thousands of tools, most of which you would never even consider to click on. You can't add, like, stickers or make collages--stuff like that... But it's the best app available if you just need a general editor.

I've been using this app for at least 2yrs and have loved it! But the past couple of months, the app isn't able to consistently export/save my photos. I've uninstalled & reinstalled the app multiple times, made sure I have the most recent version, & checked my permissions. Most of the time now it won't export or save my edited photo. Then randomly, it will saves/export a photo. But the next photo I work on, it won't save/ export. Not sure what's happened. Sadly now, looking for another editor.

Great app! However, it can be improved. The healing tool doesn‚Äôt erase things very well & you aren't allowed to adjust the size unless you zoom in & out. This is a similar problem when adding double exposure; I wish it had the option to make the eraser tool bigger or smaller. That way it can be more precise when erasing or healing an object. Another feature to add is the undo and redo button while editing at all times. Lastly, to allow you to increase or reduce the "Looks" sensitivity.

Okay. They've "fixed" the uploading feature. You still can't easily access your files - "Recent" is a useless feature - but now at least Albums has my files. Unfortunately it's in a random order - not alphabetical, because why would anyone want that? - and it's mixed in with Photos Albums. Even worse, the app now changes the name of the file, so when you export, it's difficult to simply replace the original photo. Why do they keep making this HARDER to use?

I like it very much. Especially the zero-loss of resolution after editing. 2 requests: please provide a means of adjusting font size (especially with the line text formats, which are always way too small compared to the rest of the text formats) & justify (instead of only center justify) within the text tool. Other than that, no complaints after 1 year of use. üëçüëç

I've been using this app for over 2 years now&can say without a doubt that snapseed is probably the best free alternative to any of the other photo editing apps. All the tools are free with no subscription required, unlike litterly every other app out there. If the tools are used right, you can do things on your phone just like what people do in Photoshop. The only thing I don't like is if you leave snapseed on your phone. 5 min-1hr. All your progress will be gone unless it was saved, sadly.

NO ADS !!! 5 stars for that ! I would offer this though...back in the day, when apps were called programs xD I had one that could filter out the patterns in a scanned image from a magazine, or newspaper. What we need now is a filter to get rid of the pattern imbedded in an image when taking a photo of a monitor. I used the grainy filter & that works...but the photo is obviously grainy. There maybe something better in the app already, I just haven't found it. Thanks, cool app. Lightweight too

While this does have some issues that, if addressed, it would make this a good app. The only way to adjust font size is to zoom in/out. The ability to flip verically/horizontally would be nice. More editing features would help. No need for cat ears, rabbit nose, or beaver teeth type photo editing. Leave that to the kids. I used this app to edit 1,135 photos & upload them to the cloud. This is a basic app that does the job. Fixing a few bugs in this would make it a real good app.

I'm going to try reinstalling this a third time.. I've loved using this app and the healing and brush tools have become necessary for the work I do in product photography. For some reason it's not saving my work. I've lost hours! How is this Editor's Choice? I do my edits, it looks like it's saving the work and then I get an error message saying couldn't save photo. I load photos from my Google account. If this isn't fixed soon it should be discontinued. The most important function not working?!

Please Please work more on this app, this has so much potential, but there are a few things that need to be fix, like the Healing tool needs a bit more help, an option to select a part of the image to replace another part would be great. Also the zoom in feature, I would love if the zoom in length wasnt so dependent on how much pixels the image has. And Another thing, sometimes during a long editing process the image sometimes losses in quality or losses the edits done to it. Fix this Please.

I've been using Snapseed for years and have never really had an issue. Until now. I can now only access images in three albums on my Android phone (camera, screenshots, downloads). I have multiple folders with photos in them I was able to access even yesterday, but now cannot after selecting "open." It was working ok, froze up, refreshed without warning; access to all but those three albums disappeared. Very irritated. I even uninstalled and reinstalled the app, no luck. Extremely frustrating.

Best mobile editor I've found. It's a very powerful tool. It's pretty seamless on Android. If I had any recommendations for the developers it would be this: Let us control where/what folder photos save/export to in the settings, just like we choose our quality. Next, provide optional, relatable descriptions of each tool. There are many tools that are very powerful, but take a lot of figuring out. Otherwise, I love Snapseed. I use it professionally as am alternative to Lightroom.

Used to be great, but since they changed the file picking system, it's become really annoying to use. Before I could choose images from different apps and accounts with relative ease. That's gone now and if it isn't on my phone or main google photos account, i have to go download it first. Sure, I could go the the image first and open it in Snapseed, but then I lose file saving controls.

Dropped my review to 2 stars. It doesn't appear the app developers have tried fixing the crash issues, and they're only getting worse. Struggling with this recently. With certain features in use, the app crashes. Using the perspective and cropping tools in particular. Can't keep the app open long enough to edit a photo. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars.

Heard about Snapseed can add text to Google photo. Yes it can, but they add two long dash lines to flank whatever text you add. Why do they think all users want that? The text can be rotated and zoom, but there is a limit on the minimal size allowed, so I can't shrink it to the size I want. The text font cannot be modified, and once it is saved there is no way to modify. But this is minor issue. If u are like me wanting an app to add text, this is not for you.

I love it for the most part. I just really wish I could zoom in more for healing. I like to restore pictures and working on faces is very difficult since I can't get close enough to make the brush small enough to get to small spaces such as between the nose and mouth. I end up almost giving the people a 2nd nose, lol. It's common for an eye to show up on their cheek or forehead too. Quite frustrating. Other than that, it's my favorite editing app. :)

This is a great app. I'm a newbie when it comes to editing photos so keep that in mind. This has a lot of tools and filters to muck about your pics. Free. Ads? Maybe I've been using it so long and they're just the non disruptive ones down at the bottom of the screen. If so they're not there all the time. No video ads for sure. I use it as the editor via my Gallery app. Convenient. Perfect for what I want to do with it: crop, add tonal contrast. Maybe try a filter or two. Noob stuff.

Has always been the first of a handful of essential photo editing apps I install on my devices. When it works, it works well and has options you can't find replicated elsewhere. Sadly, for about 4 months, I often have to delete and reinstall because simply trying to open a photo causes a crash "Snapseed has stopped". It will work for a few days after reinstall, but inevitably start crashing when trying to open a photo.

This is the best app for photo editing software available for Android. the features here are almost close to what you get in photoshop. I use it for a wide variety of editing, and it delivers on all fronts. Have a few suggestions though: 1. support for .png images in double exposure 2. ability to provide extra editing in double exposure, like you have the ability to modify multiple layers. Currently it has very limited ability for double exposure. 3. Ability to save current work not just image.

This is a great app for photo editing. A ton of tools, intuitive interface, plus can edit RAW photos. I would give five stars. But for some reason, the app no longer saves edited pictures into the /snapseed folder, and instead leaves them in "Photos". Which means if you have a lot of pics and are editing one from a while ago, you now have to sift through all your photos to find it. Might not sound like much, but trying to find many edited pics over multiple months is a nightmare. Please fix :(

Literally all I have wanted to do was add text to a photo. Because it is all templates text comes out either in one line or as a weird stamp or word bubble. There is little control at all over the appearance of the text. Furthermore, when trying to enlarge it the text will only go so big, leaving it impossible to read. All I want is to be able to do is align my text, resize it, choose a font. There are absurd limitations placed on this process.

Please bring back ability to expand just one border! I love this app, but sometime ago, they removed the one thing that, to me, had set this app apart from the others, that is, the ability to expand the image only in the one side that I need it, and smartly filling in the info. This had been very useful for correcting photos where the subject needs to be a little bit farther from just one edge. But now the program will only expand ALL the borders at once, which is useless to me.

Terrific app! I've had it for at least two years now, and use it all the time. I do have a couple of requests though.. Would you please consider updating your fonts? I always put a watermark on my images and it would be very nice to have more fonts to choose from. Also.. Will you please add a 'Noise' reduction feature? Thanks!!

Recent updates NOT GOOD. I've used this as my primary photo editing app for a few years now and have loved it. As others say, files are no longer being saved to the "Snapseed" folder and are instead dumped in with everything on my camera, which makes it much harder to find what I'm looking for later on. Also, if I'm editing a photo, leave the app to go look at something else then return, the photo that I was editing is gone. Please fix this. Otherwise love Snapseed!

I like this app a lot but I can't access my photos from my android phone gallery on it. I have troubleshooted completely. There is no way to contact anyone about this either. If the developer sees this- please update how photos are pulled in your app. I would think the basic photo storage app included with every phone would be one that is accessible for a photo editing app. Due to this, there is a big hassle with accessing any photos to edit, making me transfer them to a different storage app.

This is a really good photo editing tool to have. There are 4 reasons to use this app. 1. Doesnt force you to make an account like Adobe PS. 2. So simple and easy to use. Simply take a photo from your gallery and start editing. That easy! 3. Many options so you can go for many different effects. 3. Also, no gimmicks or in app purchases.

This is probably the best free photo editing app you can find. It has the same plus more features than Lightroom Premium, which costs a monthly fee. It isn't as easy to use as some other apps and lacks tutorials, but learning to use it allows you to greatly improve your photography quick and on the go. The UI is bland, but it allows for ease of use in distinguishing the features. I wish there was an undo button for when you are editing a specific feature rather than having to leave the feature.

Overall this has seemed to be the best alternative to photoshop I've been able to find. But I'd like to see a few changes. A separate menu between actual tools and all the filters would be nice. The "Brush" tool would be even better with a size meter/option to control, along with some of the options under "Tune" to be available in the "Brush" tool in order to get them more precise. Maybe an undo button instead of eraser. And some sort of overall tool for smoothing/dehazing/color noise as well.

The app is honestly amazing, I'm not sure how it could be better other than two things: 1) When editing, the image often appears to have more saturation or warmness than it will when you actually export it so you have to compensate for that. 2) It'd be nice if under the "Expand" tool you could expand it so the borders are simply a blurred zoom in of the actual picture, the only options you have are black and white and the mirror border looks a lot better for many pictures

My favorite photo editing app. The only issue I have is when I'm done editing(and have more than 5 edits) snapseed will force close itself. It makes me so mad I bought another photo editor... but it sucks, so I'm back to using Snapseed.. I really wish they could fix whatever issue it is that makes the app stop working..especially when I've been editing the same photo for a few hours..then I have to start all the way overüòê other than that...great app! üòä

Great app, got me into photography and digital editing, with lots of unique features separate from Google Photos, and tutorials (that could use an update) that teach you the basics of stylistic photo editing. My two small complaints are that I think choosing to edit a photo with Snapseed in the Google Photos edit menu should open up the actual app, and the app's icon doesn't have a themed app icon (although that feature is still in beta). Overall an amazing app that I use a lot.

i suppose some useful tools. BIG holdback for me is that the cropping tool DOESN'T incl ANY factor for making circles, ovals, etc. ONLY FORMS OF SQUARES. I thought I'd check out the Frames tool, to see if there were circles, ovals, etc. Of course NOT. I'm not out in left field, wanting/needing to use a real world cropping tool. Hundreds of thousands of us out here, for starters. I've uninstalled.

Snapseed has been my editing companion for years! It‚Äôs one of the best photo editing apps out there‚Äîsimple, powerful, and completely free. From basic adjustments to advanced tools like selective editing and healing, it never fails to enhance my photos just the way I want. Truly a must-have for anyone who loves clean and professional edits!

Edit 15/10/2024: recently the photos I see in the app while editing don't look the same as the ones in my gallery after I've saved/exported. I've gone so far as to take a screenshot of the picture in Snapseed while editing, then saving and looking at them side by side, and they're very different. This is a real issue. The app otherwise is still great, but if I can't save an image so that it looks the same as how I edited it to look, what's the point?

A pretty good - and free - editor. My usual go-to for doing most edits on photos I've taken. It could do with a few more text options, an ability to draw onto images (its "brush" is hopeless), and could someone please stop it from deleting EXIF info from the edited files? That's such a schoolboy error.

I normally like using Snapseed as part as my usual mobile workflow and think it is very good. However, I think the latest update is messed up because I wasted around 20 minutes editing the same photo and the app tells me it cannot save it when I try to Export. Please fix this issue quickly because it is highly frustrating. Thank-you

The finest image editing app available for free, which has lots of useful features; I personally like the "Expand" feature, along with the various other filters and adjustable options. I would like a better "Healing" performance in the center of image as it at the edges. Also, would like to have the ability to "Crop" with respect to device dimensions.

Snapspeed is a fantastic, powerful, and easy to use photo editing app. It provides good control over different elements of the photo without going into too much unnecessary detail. For most cases, snapspeed is enough to do whatever you want to do with your photo. Definitely a perfect solution for on the go editing where importing into Photoshop on a computer would be unnecessary. Perfect for enhancing photos taken on your phone.

This really is the best mobile app for image editing I've found, but a couple of things would make it better. When cropping a small image, it would be nice to have it fill the screen, so I can be somewhat precise about what I'm cutting off. And it seems strange to have no option for simply drawing on an image. I like the brushes for burning, dodging, saturation etc., but there are times I simply need to circle or highlight or block something out.

Easy to use app & the best of it is that it doesn't force users to watch a single ad, that's great for a free version! -- However, the fact that the text cannot be edited without saving changes is really frustrating, for example if I want to use different text styles in the same image, I have to save one by one. I use the app to add motivational quotes to landscapes or any other image that is not precisely a photograph, please allow us to use multiple text styles and fonts at the same time. TY!

I love this app, since I discovered it I have been using it for all my edits, but I would like suggest things that would make it way better. First, addition of clipping mask, it's makes things a lot easier, secondly, warp feature, to allow us fit images as we like, third, a whole new set of brushes, like Photoshop on PC, having brushes like blending brush, lighting brush, and other brushes will make things easier, faster and more efficient. Pls add these things ASAPüåü

Its a very good app to edit your images. It has a lot of tools to make your pics and images pop. However, recently it has started crashing regularly. After doing all my edits when I try to save my image it says "Could not save photo" and closes the app. This has become really frustrating as it wastes a lot of effort put into enhancing the image. Hope this is being looked into .....

On newer devices (galaxy s24, a56), as opposed to older ones, colors after exporting the picture look different than what they looked in the app. In the app they are less vivid (also compared to the original picture, when viewing it in the phone gallery). Now I've noticed that it also affect local changes, like the healing tool. The fix looks perfect and clean in the app, but after exporting you can totally see the edges of it.

Have been using this app for years to edit my photos as it was nice, quick and easy. However, a recent update made it so I can no longer go through file manager to find the folder of the images I want to edit. As someone who shoots many different cameras, this is a huge problem. Tried to contact support but email is no longer monitored. No where else to get support. Also there is no way to sync your edit profiles so you lose them if you uninstall. I'll have to find a new editing app.

This is one of the best mobile editing apps out there! It can do almost everything you can imagine with a little bit more effort. But the only problem I have with it, is that the stacks brush, one of the MOST USEFUL FEATURES, is really frustrating to use. If you zoom out, the edges of the brush are REALLY soft. Which makes getting a clean, sharp mask nearly impossible. A suggestion is to add a button or even a slider that triggers the hardness of the brush from soft to completely hard.

It's a great app for editing for photos. I've been using since 5 or 6 years and it has been a companion in my photographic journey for quick editing and uploading into social media. Expand, perspective, healing, film simulations are some of the great features of this free app. But I'm lacking the availability of gradient filter , radial filters and adjusting the exposure. I hope you guys work on that too.

Some really good tools. User friendly and love the tutorials. No ads (thanks Google!). Sadly, it's missing something very important: freehand drawing and shapes. The brush feature is the closest, but you can't draw thin lines or insert shapes like squares, circles or triangles. Hope they plan to add this, because now I have to use a seperate app for this.

I love this app. It's perfect for mobile photography. However, the app could use a "Drafts" Folder so you can go back to your unfinished work and not start all over again. Also, this "Drafts" Folder can be helpful if you want to edit the same photo in different filters or mood. Lastly, since the app doesn't have a Sticker tool, it will be helpful if you can use. PNG files on the exposure. Thank you.

I love it! It's really easy to use. I don't edit pictures of myself, but of the accessories I make. This app is amazing for me regarding small touch-ups and that is all I need. It has a lot of features, but I didn't really explore more than the Healing tool to remove my cat's tiny hairs from the background and the classical adjustments. I rarely use the Brush tool and I love that you can add text, I am sure others use it more professionally. I am too lazy to use photoshop for the editing I need.

title: YouTube for Android TV
description: Experience YouTube on TV and transform your viewing experience beyond just movies and shows. Discover endless entertainment options for every moment, whether you have a few minutes or hours. Sign in to enjoy fresh, personalized content. Watch the latest content from your favorite creators, dive deep into your passions, learn new skills, and explore topics that inspire you. Stay informed with podcasts, live news, and sports. Find fresh music, watch blockbuster movies, and keep up with your favorite TV shows. Parents can also add and manage a kid account to guide your child‚Äôs discovery with content settings that you choose. With YouTube on your TV, there‚Äôs always something new to enjoy. It's an all-in-one, easy to use TV app for effortless and engaging entertainment at home.

scraped_reviews.content: FEATURE REQUEST! It would be nice & help if you could organize our subscriptions list back in alphabetical order again instead of having them all scrambled up with no organization to them. It takes forever to scroll through them to find a certain channel you are subscribed to. You can alphabetize them in YouTube on your computer but not on your Android TV App. Makes no sense. How hard is it to write code to fix this. It use to be alphabetized but after an update it went away. Please fix.

Used to work great, but just like everyone else since the last few updates, videos will randomly freeze but the audio will continue. If y'all would please actually fix the issue instead of ignoring it, that would be great. (Also it's not an issue on my end, my WiFi is exentlent and has no problems with anything but this version of YouTube. It's a problem with the app and I and many other people would very much like it fixed.)

The subscriptions are in a seemingly random order on the "Subscriptions" tab. It used to have a suggested ones at the top, followed by the rest in alphabetical order. Made it easy to find the subscribed channel. Now it is a chore trying to locate the one channel I want, or having to type it in every time. Go back to the way it was! (Or at least offer a way to choose sorting options)

Accessibility issue: no option to increase the font size (which is tiny). The ABC on-screen keyboard is a joke, so I started using an external keyboard. Not possible to watch and browse other videos at the same time. Not possible to play picture-in-picture and do other stuff on the TV. The PIP mode should simply close whenever another app starts playing media. What we need is the YT mobile app with QWERTY keyboard and more settings (like font size, interface theme etc.)

Too damn many ads! You MUST watch an ad before EVERY video you choose. The frustrating part is two seconds into the video you realize this isn't what you wanted to see. You go and click on another video and now you MUST watch another ad. And the cycle just keep repeating itself. You end up watching six, seven or even more ads before you get to watch what you're really looking for. And it comes preinstalled (using up your space), so you can't uninstall it. There has to be a device out there that doesn't force their unwanted apps on you, TAKING up all of your space that you could be using for apps that you actually want.

It's a good app, and pretty well made for a TV. But two weeks ago, you had less ads for twenty or thirty seconds if you were watching a "long video", when the video was longer than twenty minutes, which is completely reasonable. However, though, I watch videos that are less than five minutes and I dozens of ads for a whole minute or so, and I always end up watching ads more than videos themselves. It's extremely frustrating if you want to sit in the couch and watch TV after a long day after school or something and get this. Please change the goddamn ads.

Been using this app for years, this used to be an awesome app, now Its USELESS! after the recent update, 3x smart TV's in my house unable to use youtibe, its very frustrating, SCREEN JUST GRAY when you open the app, only way to get it to open is to delete all data from app settings, and then you have to go about the tiring task of signing into your account. only to have to go through it all over again next time you want to watch YouTube on your android TV. SO FRUSTRATING, please FIX the problem!

I can't use YouTube, the screen is grey and nothing is showing. What's really going on huh! It's really frustrating. If it continues on like this updates after updates I'll have no choice but to cancel my Premium because it's useless for real at this point on my TV where it's really needed.

I am using a TV box, and lately this app has been acting up. When I try to open it, it shows the YouTube logo then it goes to a grey or black screen. I tried force stopping the app, there were times that it would work, but lately it hasn't been. It's been a month and now I don't know what to do. Please do anything you can! Thank you.

I use YouTube almost exclusively and the app is fine for Google TV. However, build 6.24.303 has been highly annoying. If the chromecast ever goes to the screen saver, and then I try to open YouTube directly, the app always crashes on the startup splash and I have to go into the settings and force stop it for it to open properly

not sure whether it's due to the new updates, the latest App version is not working on my TV. the screen turns to grey without any other information. have to delete the latest version every time and use the old one to make it work!

YouTube app 6.28.300: YouTube music audio quality is the most low quality audio in a Android TV music streaming app at the moment 160kbps. Both Spotify and Tidal delivers much higher audio quality minimum 256kbps. I'm missing audio dynamics and audio sounds almost it's in mono with YouTube music. 160 kbps audio is very low audio quality, so why do you call it Premium? Free users and Premium subscribers gets the same audio quality. So what do I really get for my post paid membership? YouTube music presents old irrelevant music in the recommendations that once again shows that they doesn't care about the YouTube Premium memberships best interests.
The app was running smoothly before but since last month it has started having issues, when opening the app it just becomes grey and refuse to open. Please fix this already.
it's a good app but there's a bug that when I open the app the screen goes grey and won't allow me to go the main place where we open the app when I unplug the TV pls fix the bug
App was good all along until October, now it crashes, can not open, remains grey and blank, music app not even opening as well. Please fix this bug
Keeps crashing on TCL smart tv, then I must delete cache and data every time to get it working again. Buggy and poor UI design. Web browser version is much better.
The app is good when it works. However, it is now starting to be unstable and requires uninstall and reinstall frequently.

many kinds of videos for any kind of genre any one might be interested in. The only downside to this social video streaming platform app is many ad's too many you must pay in order to avoid all the annoying adds.

years ago it was a nice app that I got sucked on.but now it's not even working on my google tv, every time it always crash no matter how much I tried to fix it or if I get a chance of scrolling,after like 3 or 4 seconds it would still since the last major update,and also from the last 2 updates I hate it that just a simple history turn into a complicated thing like making macaron.also now aside of that I'm forced to go to another tv into another brand of my TV ten I could watch videos from YouTube.pls fix this bug and I'll appreciate it. like pls fully fix it until it never happen again l beg you PLEASE FIX THIS BUG

The app generally works well but it has been _super_ annoying lately having to select an account every time I open the app. It used to always remember the selection or let me pick the default. Since I've literally never used anything other than the main account, the screen is really frustrating

Seriously hate that the new default right or left arrow goes across the bottom menu "buttons" for subscribe, like, comments etc. Instead of rewinding or fast forwarding like before. This is absolute trash. I want to revert to the previous version. Had to uninstall its updates so I don't have to deal with this.

Very good, great quality videos. The only thing I have problem with is the duration of the ads. I was watching a 8 minute video and YouTube gave me a 1 minute, unskipable ad saying "longer ads for this long video". It used to say that for 20 minute videos and that was understandable but a 8 minute vid? Is 8 minutes that long???

Overall good app, but since latest update the optimization and performance is bad. When I'm in a video and press any button on my remote it takes about 1-3 seconds to bring up the controls overlay. this is a downgrade from previous versions. Sure, make it look better, but not at the cost of performance of the controls.

In general I loved the app, but the most recent update has changed a fundamental function and has severely degraded the user experience. Before the update, pressing left or right would start scrubbing forward and backwards through a video, now it goes to thumbs up/down etc, you have to go up before you can scrub through a video, which isn't intuitive and irks us EVERY SINGLE TIME üò•

ever since they upgraded the ui, the user experience has been abysmal....it broke muscle memory, added additional unnecessary steps to do anythingand it's just a genuinely worst experience. definitely would not recommend.
The YouTube experience is good but the minimum time for an advertisement is 35 SECONDS. please make it lower or reduce ads displayed.
Excellent app. But there are a few bugs like sometimes when I start the app it's screen becomes grey and the videos loose their thumbnails and just becomes a heading. But overall it is nice.

honestly, this app is amazing for everyone to watch just to entertain, however the UI currently used today is a bit awful. First of all, is that the screen used as a corner currently is round corner. Ok so everytime I tried to read at the corner, it always blocked. That will be four out of five

videos will play for several seconds and then the screen will freeze and then it always drops me to the main menu I've done all the updates and resets and everything and nothing fixes this extremely frustrating

Ads are insane of 60sec multiple times throughout the video, with a few 5sec ones with the option to skip and immediately presented with a 30+sec advertisement. Reading comments is also a poor experience.
